El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad.
Gugnara tiene un restaurante desde hace 16 años al cual le dedica 8 a 9 horas cada día que por lo general son en la tarde y gran parte de la noche. Cada año ella ha visto que sus clientes son más y es por eso que el local en donde actualmente atiende ya no abastece la demanda de sus clientes, es por eso que ahora Gugnara piensa ampliar el lugar aumentando algo de mesas y espacios para dar la mejor atención a sus clientes. Por esta razón esta mujer trabajadora y esforzada solicitó un préstamo que le permita comprar estos activos y que de esta forma sus ingresos incrementen y poder mejorar su estilo de vida y tener un ahorro para salud y bienestar de sus años de vejez.
texts.en:
Gugnara, 50, has an elementary education, is single and has three adult children.  She lives in Quinindé, a canton of the province of Esmeraldas which supplies several cities of Ecuador with products such as bananas, cocoa, café, African palm and forest products.  Commerce is the daily work for most of the inhabitants to be able to get ahead, especially now that roads to this canton permit much trade movement on weekends when merchants go to the markets to seek potential customers, most of which are farmers.  Tourism is also a great source of income for this canton because of its natural ecosystem, with a variety of places to visit such as waterfalls, sweet water rivers, forests, and flora and fauna that adorn the city.

Gugnara has been running a restaurant for 16 year, and spends eight to nine hours a day there, usually in the afternoon and most of the evening.  Every year the number of customers grows and the location she is at now is not big enough to attend to customer demand.  So now Gugnara is thinking about expanding the restaurant and adding more tables and customer service space.  This hard-working woman is requesting a loan to buy these assets so she can increase her income and improve her lifestyle, while also saving for her health and well-being in her senior years.

loans.use: To buy assets to expand her restaurant.

loans.name: James

texts.es:
James tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee paisajes muy bonitos y sobre todo una gastronomía muy variada. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear junto a su familia, James, es padre de 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años, a quienes quiere mucho y por ello trabaja muy duro para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos James solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para poder ser Contador.

Día a día James trabaja como vendedor en una tienda de electrodomésticos de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gatos de su hogar; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable en su trabajo.

James está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como refacción de techo ya que debido a las lluvias, su vivienda se inunda y  por ello en ocasiones sus hijos se enferman; con esta mejora podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder tener una gran empresa”.
texts.en:
James is 37 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  This city is noted for its warm and welcoming climate as well as for its very beautiful landscapes and, above all, its varied cuisine.  Whenever he has any free time, James really enjoys going for walks with his family.  He is the father of two children who are 15 and 10 years old.  He loves them dearly and works very hard so that he can offer them a decent life.  He gives them a lot of love.  Owing to a lack of financial means, James could only study up to the fifth year of his secondary education but he would have liked to have gone on to study accountancy.

James works as a salesman in an electrical store in his city.  He works around 9 hours a day and his work enables him to cover his household expenses.  He believes that he is doing well in his work because he is very friendly with the customers and, above all, he is responsible in his work.

James is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help that they are providing, he will be able to make improvements to his home, repairing his roof.  This is necessary because his house floods when it rains and his children sometimes become sick.  With this improvement, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and continue working to make his biggest dreams come true: to provide his children with a good education and to own a large business.

loans.use: to improve his home (repair his roof)

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio tiene 48 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, con pareja e hijos. La comunidad donde reside está ubicada a 15 minutos de Tambogrande y tiene deseos de superación.  Aun no cuentan con algunos servicios básicos.        
La actividad que desarrolla Policarpio es la venta de animales (cerdos, ovinos, cabras, aves de corral).  La actividad se la reparten entre pareja la cual atiende el negocio mientras él trabaja como peón agrícola.  Se dedica a la crianza de animales hace aproximadamente más de 10 años.  Con los ingresos que perciben ambos cubren sus gastos y los de su familia.
Policarpio ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles, esto para compra de alimento balanceado para animales y mejoras en el corral de los mismos.
Para eso cliente cuenta con grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio. Cliente es conocido en la zona y cuenta con clientela establecida.
texts.en:
Policarpio is 48 years old, lives with his partner, and has four dependent children.  He lives in his own home together with his partner and children.  The community in which he lives is located 15 minutes from Tambogrande and he has a desire to better himself.  His family still do not receive some basic services.

Policarpio's business is selling animals (pigs, sheep, goats and farmyard birds).  He shares the work with his partner, who looks after the business while he works as a farm laborer.  He has been raising animals for approximately 10 years.  With the income that the couple make, they manage to cover their family's expenses.

Policarpio has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for his animals and make some improvements to their pens.

This client has a great desire to better himself and to grow in his business.  He is well known in the area and has existing customers.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for his livestock and to improve his pens

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es:
José tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y vive con su familia en casa propia, la misma que está ubicada en la Región Lambayeque, en una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
José se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de la crianza y venta de animales, en su propio domicilio.  Cuenta con clientela fija, los vecinos de su zona y los comerciantes que llegan al lugar.  Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura.  Su cónyuge se dedica a labores como jornal.
Actualmente se proyecta a incrementar su negocio de venta de animales, comprando más ganado.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old, marrried, and lives with his family in his own home in Lambayeque region.  He lives in a rural area, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, where people mainly work in farming.

José has been raising and selling animals at home for three years.  He has an established customer base comprising local people and traders who come to his area.  In addition, he also farms.  His wife works as a daily laborer.

José currently plans to increase his animal business by purchasing more livestock.  He has decided to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy livestock which he will later sell

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents at their modest house located in one of the beautiful Lebanese villages. Ashraf spent many years in solving home electricity issues, but he’s not the only one covering the family expenses: he has his father, who is considered the main income provider in the family.

Ashraf always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work, but until now he earns a barely fair income. For that reason he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his electrical equipment and purchase needed items. He confirms that the loan will help him increase his sales and, thus, his income by 15%. And as Ashraf works independently, he wishes to have his own electrical equipment shop soon in order to keep on responding to client demand the best he possibly can.

loans.use: to renew his electrical equipment and purchase needed items

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 26-year-old man living in Lebanon. He’s single but would loved to get married soon and have his own family and children.  He’s living now with his parent and sibling.  Together with his brother, they enhanced their living conditions. Elie has been working as a caterer from home.  He’s specialized in preparing and, once ready, delivering food for any occasion. Through his job, he will be able to cover their needs the best he possibly can. Even though, he finds it really hard to stand on his own.

This is the reason why he’s asking today for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a car for his business. With this opportunity, he will be able to deliver his food in good condition and on time, which is the most important thing. In the future, he plans to have his own catering company.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Musank

texts.en:
Musank is a 52-year-old married man. He describes himself to be a humble man. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock such as sheep, goats, cows, etc. His business is located within a potential business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for livestock due to prolonged drought and the electricity in the area.

He will use the 5,800 KES loan to buy a solar lantern. His business goal is to buy goats for reselling within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children with profits he will get from the business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha used her previous loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seeds. She was able to plant the potatoes and make a profit.

This is her second loan. She plans to buy a dairy cow for rearing for milk production. With the anticipated income she will pay school fees for her children.

In the future she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a commercial building and make more income as well as provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 45 años, tiene 1 hijo de veinticuatro años y una hija de diecisiete años, con quien sueña ver convertida en una profesional exitosa. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace   5 años,  experiencia, que tomó  después de haber trabajado durante varios años en un colegio y también en una microempresa. Entusiasmada por ser independiente decidió aprovechar su experiencia en culinaria y su buena sazón, para preparar pasteles y venderlos entre sus vecinos, para que estos le pagaran quincenalmente cuando recibieran el dinero producto de su trabajo. Con esta tarea le fue muy bien y tiempo después aprovechó esta misma clientela para satisfacer otras necesidades de y deseo, por eso inició su venta  de productos por catalogo por recomendación de una amiga, también puso mucho empeño y entusiasmo a este nuevo negocio y sacó sus mejores resultados; actualmente ofrece cosméticos y pasteles al mismo tiempo y hoy sus clientes no solo son sus vecinos del sector sino también referidos por estos, su meta actual es   cumplirle a sus clientes con  los pedidos, que le hicieron para la celebración del día del amor y la amistad, por eso acude a un credikiva para responderles oportunamente, pues su desafío es su insuficiente capital de trabajo   para lograrla.
Con su credikiva comprará productos en mayor volumen como  shampoo, masajes, cremas, jabones, maquillaje; así mismo invertirá en la compra de materiales para los pasteles;  con esta inversión planea que su negocio logrará cumplir los pedidos de sus clientes para el mes de amor y amistad y esta es una de sus razones de éxito.,
texts.en:
Magaly is 45 years old.  She has a 24-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter.  She dreams of her daughter becoming a successful professional.  Magaly has owned her own business for the past five years.  She started her business after having worked for several years in a school and also in a small business.  She was keen to start working independently, so she decided to make the most of her culinary experience and the fact that she is a good cook and start making cakes to sell to her neighbors.  Her customers paid her every two weeks when they had money from work.  This business went very well and she later decided to make the most of her existing customer base and satisfy more of their needs and wishes.  A friend recommended that she started selling catalog products.  She put a lot of effort and enthusiasm into this new business and experienced really good results.  She now sells both cosmetics and cakes and her customers are not only her neighbors but also other people who they have recommended her to. 

Magaly's current goal is to fill the orders that her customers have placed for 'love and friendship day' (the Colombian equivalent of St Valentines Day which is celebrated in late September).  She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can fill their orders in a timely manner because the challenge she faces is that she doesn't have enough working capital to do this.  Magaly will use her Kiva loan to buy products such as shampoos, massagers, creams, soaps and makeup in larger quantities.  She will also invest in buying supplies for making cakes.  With this investment, she plans to fill her customers' orders for 'love and friendship day' and this is one of the reasons she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, massagers, creams, soaps and makeup

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary used his previous loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in his shop. It was profitable and he was able to repay the loan amount well and in good time.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil and maize flour. He plans to grow his business and open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Milton Cesar

texts.es:
Milton tiene 34 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia, hace más de 6 años con cónyuge e hijos, reside en el Caserío San Pablo Hualtaco del Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Y cuenta con algunos servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la agrícola como actividad principal y la crianza de ovinos, chanchos y aves de corral como actividad complementaria, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace mas de 5 años, además cuenta con  0,5 ha de terreno agrícola sembrados de limón, los cuales fueron heredados por padre, esposa quien cría aves de corral, además  lo apoya en toda  actividad que realiza. 
Milton ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para la mejor cosecha del limón y compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado.  De esta manera podrá venderlos a un mejor precio y seguirá creciendo en su negocio lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milton is 34 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  He lives in his own home.  He has lived with his wife and children in the small village of San Pablo Hualtaco, in the district of Tambogrande, for more than six years.  He lives in the rural part of this district and receives some basic services.

Milton's main business activity is farming and his secondary business activity is livestock raising.  He has been in business for more than five years and has 0.5 hectares of farmland, which he inherited from his father, where he grows lemons.  His wife raises farmyard birds and supports him in all his work.

Milton has requested a loan for 1,000 soles to buy fertilizer, so that he can achieve a better lemon harvest.  He will also buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten his livestock.  This will enable him to sell them for a better price and he will be able to continue growing in his business.  This, in turn, will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops and nutritionally-balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 27 years old and lives with her partner and four children in the town of Msambweni.

For one year, Halima has been selling merchandise from home and by mail order. She sells new khangas (a wraparound garment made from a single piece of fabric).

This is her first loan with Yehu, which she needs to keep her business competitive. The loan is for 20,000 Kenyan shillings and she will use it to buy a bundle of clothing. In this way, Halima will be able to maintain a proper level of inventory and reach new markets.

Her plans are to increase her sales and eventually have a clothing store and hire employees, so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase of a bundle of clothing.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesus da muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y dice que ojalá lo sigan apoyando para seguir progresando en su negocio y así en su vida familiar” Con su anterior credikiva compró ropa y calzado de muy buena marca  al por mayor y de contado, obteniendo descuentos especiales; hoy se prepara para recibir un nuevo financiamiento,  aprovechando que se acerca la segunda temporada del año y con ello el incremento de sus ventas. Jesus  debe tener mucho inventario del que mas rota para esta época, por eso con su credikiva comprará ropa y calzado, proyectándo el aumento de sus utilidades y haciendo crecer cada vez mas su negocio.
texts.en: Jesus is very thankful to Kiva and the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and says that he hopes they will continue to support him so that he can continue to progress in his business and his family life. With his previous CrediKiva he purchased clothes and shoes at wholesale prices, getting special discounts; today he is preparing to receive new financing, taking advantage of the fact that the second season of the year is coming up and with that an increase in sales. Jesus needs to have a lot of inventory for this season, and for this reason he will buy clothes and shoes, projecting that his utility will increase as well as his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Peñarol en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Rosa vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Y no cuenta aún con servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla Rosa es la crianza de ovinos y cerdos los cuales cría y engorda para luego sacrificarlos y/o comercializarlos en el mercado local, además cuenta con 0,50 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón, Su conviviente, se dedica a la agricultura contando con 1 has de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia donde tiene sembrado limón que cosecha semanalmente.
Rosa ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, cuyo destino será la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de su ganado ovino y cerdos; además para fertilizantes para cultivo de limón, lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She lives in her own home in the small village of Peñarol, in Tambogrande district.  Rosa lives in the rural part of this district and, as yet, she doesn't receive any basic services.

Rosa's business is raising sheep and pigs.  She raises and fattens the animals then slaughters them and / or sells them in the local market.  She also has 0.5 hectares of farmland where she grows lemons.  Her partner farms.  He has one hectare of farmland, which his dad gave him as his inheritance, where he grows lemons.  He harvests the lemons weekly.

Rosa has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for fattening her sheep and pigs.  She will also buy fertilizers for her lemon crops.  This will allow her to continue growing in her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nutrionally-balanced feed for her livestock and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Úrsula, tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en el Caserío Paredones Alto, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. 
La actividad que realiza Úrsula es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Úrsula cría pavos, gallinas y porcinos, los alimenta con maíz, pastos naturales y otros. Negocia quincenalmente sus animales. Su cònyuge se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrada lenteja.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.
Úrsula desea comprar alimento para animales y darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos agrícolas.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Ursula is 62 years old, married, and has no dependent children. She lives in Caserio Paredones Alto, located some 15 minutes from the city of Morrope. 

Ursula raises farm animals, using corrals located in the exterior part of her home. Ursula raises turkeys, hens, and pigs, and feeds them corn, natural forage and other foods. She sells her animals every two weeks.

Ursula's husband is a farmer whose land is planted in lentils. With the income he receives, he covers his expenses and those of his family.

Ursula wishes to purchase feed for her animals and provide maintenance for their crops. That's why she has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols to achieve her objective.

loans.use: buy balanced feed for her animals and perform maintenance on her crops.

loans.name: Yesica Liliana

texts.es:
Yésica tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente, vive junto a sus 02 menores hijos de 06 y 04 años de edad.  Vive en casa propia de material rustico y de corte tradicional en el distrito de Mochumí, una localidad dedicada principalmente a la agricultura que se encuentra situada en la localidad de Lambayeque, a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Su cónyuge desarrolla labores de jornalero en el Molino San Miguel del Distrito de Lambayeque.
Yésica, en la parte posterior de su casa tiene corrales en los cuales cría animales menores tales como pavos, patos, pollos, etc., estos cuando ya alcanzas niveles adecuados de desarrollo los vende a los comerciantes de la zona.  Con los ingresos percibidos cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.
Yésica desea invertir en la compra de alimento para animales y compra de animales menores con fines de engorde, para poder venderlos al mejor precio y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de sus menores hijos.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yesica, 26, lives with a partner and her 2 children aged 6 and 4.  She lives in her own home, which is a traditional style home built out of rustic materials.  The house is located in Mochumi district in the Lambayeque region, more than a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.  It is a place that is devoted mainly to agricultural production.  Yesica's partner works as a hired hand in the San Miguel mill in Lambayeque. 

At the rear of her house, Yesica has corrals where she raises small animals such as turkeys, ducks and chickens.  When the animals reach an adequate level of development, she sells them to the traders in the area.  With the income she earns, she covers her expenses and those of her family.  

Yesica wants to invest in her business by purchasing animal feed and some small animals to fatten.  This way, she will be able to sell them at a better price, so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her small children.  This is the reason why she is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo.  Reside en el caserío Puplan en Túcume, zona turística, muy visitada por las pirámides que tienen, ubicada a 45 Minutos de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
José se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de abarrotes y venta de animales, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y los comerciantes que llegan a la zona.  Adicionalmente posee una moto carguera, lo que le permite obtener ingresos adicionales.
Actualmente José se ha propuesto incrementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, comprando más productos para su venta y también desea comprar más animales, engordarlos y venderlos.  Es por ello que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old, single, and has one son.  He lives in the small village of Puplan, in Túcume.  This is a tourist area which receives a lot of visitors because of its [pre-Hispanic] pyramids.  It is 45 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

José has been selling groceries and selling animals for five years.  His business is located in his home.  His main customers are his neighbors and traders who come to the area.  He also owns a 'moto carguera' (a motorcycle equipped for carrying cargo) which makes him additional income.

José would like to expand his grocery store business, buying more products to sell.  He would also like to buy more animals to fatten and sell.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy groceries (noodles, mixed veg, rice, etc.) and animals to sell

loans.name: Jose Elvis

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Puplan del Distrito de Túcume, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de tres años a la comercialización de ganado menor, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona. Este negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante y sostener la economía de su familia, por lo que trata siempre de mantenerlo con mucho esfuerzo.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y posee una moto carguera.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y venderlos. Siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

El es un padre de familia bastante entregado a su trabajo y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
José is a 23-year-old father who lives together with his family in the small village of Puplan, in Túcume district, in Lambayeque province, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been selling livestock for more than three years.  He fattens the animals and then sells them to traders who visit his area.  This business provides him with the income he needs to make progress and financially support his family.  For this reason, he always puts a lot of effort into maintaining it.  In parallel with this activity, he also sells groceries and owns a 'moto carguera' (a motorcycle adapted for transporting cargo).

José would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals to raise and sell.  In order to achieve this goal, he needs to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

José is a father who is dedicated to his work and who is always looking out for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and then sell

loans.name: Cristian Geovanny

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven de 24 años, bachiller, que está casado con Elsa de su misma edad, tienen 2 hijos de tres y un año. Juntos viven en Pujilí, un cantón ecuatoriano de la Provincia de Cotopaxi el cual fue habitado en la antigüedad por incas y que aún conserva la labor alfarera como principal actividad, en especial la elaboración de tejas esmaltadas para acabados de casas. De acuerdo a estudios realizados la pobreza por necesidades básicas que no están satisfechas supera el 80% y existe un porcentaje de entre 20 y 30 por ciento de analfabetismo. No todos sus habitantes cuentan con servicios básicos, algo en lo que las autoridades locales trabajan. A pesar de esto, este cantón es considerado un atractivo turístico muy importante de la Región Sierra por su naturaleza, la estructura colonial y antigua de sus construcciones y las costumbres que aún se conservan allí. Ubicado a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Latacunga, la gente de este cantón siempre da la bienvenida a los turistas con suculentos manjares típicos de su exquisita gastronomía. 
Cristian se dedica a la comercialización de flores, el cual aprendió de su madre y han pasado 8 años desde que emprendió con esta actividad, dedica 4 horas diarias a vender flores por las ciudades aledañas y a veces es muy complicado por la venta que realiza en las noches para enviar las flores a la Región Costa. Cristian desea mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia por lo que solicitó un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar flores de distinta variedad que le permitan atender las demandas de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristian is 24 years old.  He is married to Elsa, who is the same age, and they have two children, who are three and one.  They live together in Pujilí, an Ecuadorean town in the province of Cotopaxi which, in ancient times, was inhabited by the Incas and which still has potting as its main activity, especially the fabrication of enamel tiles for house fixtures.  According to various studies, levels poverty in which basic needs are not satisfied is higher than 80% in this area, and between 20 and 30% of the population is illiterate.  Not all inhabitants have sanitary services, something which the local authorities are working on.  Nevertheless, this area is considered a very important tourist attraction for the Sierra region because of its natural beauty, colonial architecture, and the ancient buildings and customs that are preserved there.  Located a few kilometers from the city of Latacunga, the town has always welcomed tourists with the succulent dishes typical of the people's delicious cuisine.

Cristian sells flowers, a trade he learned from his mother.  It has been eight years since he learned this trade, and he spends four hours a day selling flowers in nearby cities.  Sometimes, the situation is more complicated, and he sells at night in order to send the flowers to the coastal region.  Cristian wants to increase his income and his family's quality of life, and he is seeking a loan to buy different varieties of flowers so that he can met all his clients' demands.

loans.use: to buy flowers and distribute them in bulk

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos dependientes. Vive en casa de sus padres, que es propia, la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Carlos vive en zona rural.
La actividad que desarrolla Carlos es la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral, los cuales una vez que llegan a su tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Se dedica a la crianza de animales hace aproximadamente 2 años. Maneja la mototaxi de padre, la cual aporta ingresos al hogar. 
Carlos ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, para la compra de alimento balanceado para animales y adquisición de ganado pequeño, para su posterior engorde. El préstamo lo ayudara a que crezca su negocio, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old, single, and doesn't have any dependent children.  He lives in his parents' home which they own.  It is located in Tambogrande district.  Carlos lives in the rural area of the district.

Carlos' business is raising sheep, pigs and farmyard birds.  When they reach an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market.  He has been raising animals for approximately two years.  He also drives his father's motorcycle taxi which makes additional income for the household.

Carlos has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for his animals.  He will also purchase more animals to fatten.  This loan will help him to grow his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and more animals to raise

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, es un humilde agricultor de 41 años de edad, originario de la comunidad llamada Los Encuentros en las afueras de Teustepe, su nivel de escolaridad es básico solo finalizo la primaria. Ya que el igual que la mayoría de las personas del área rural, se dedican desde muy pequeños a trabajar en las labores de siembra y crianza de animales. El empezó a trabajar desde los 8 años de edad, dice que su papa le enfatizo la importancia  que tiene cuidar los cultivos pues de ello depende la subsistencia económica y alimentaria de la familia. Tiene 6 hijos entre 15 y 3 años, los chicos mayores son lo que le ayudan en las labores de siembra después de la escuela, gran parte de su producción la vende en la misma comunidad a compradores que llegan en busca de su productos. Solicito el financiamiento para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar maíz y frijol. Además de invertir en sus siembras, desea tener la posibilidad de  comprar ganado para diversificar sus ingresos de manera que le permita darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Víctor, 41, is a humble farmer from the community known as Los Encuentros on the outskirts of Teustepe.  He has minimal education and only finished primary school.  Like the majority of people in this rural area, since he was very young, he has worked in farming and raising animals.  He began working at the age of eight.  He says his father emphasized the importance of taking care of the crops because they are the source of economic subsistence and the family's food. He has six children between the ages of 15 and 3.  The older boys help with the farming after school.  Most of what he produces he sells in the same community to buyers who come in search of his products.

He is seeking a loan to buy supplies and to pay for laborers to harvest the corn and beans.  In addition to investing in his crops, he wants to have the possibility to buy cattle so that he can diversify his income and thereby give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to pay for labor to harvest corn and beans.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo tiene un paisaje muy bello así como flora y fauna maravilloso, asimismo sus pobladores son personas generosas y amables. Rogelio e un hombre muy trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “aguadito de Pollo”. Rogelio solo estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria ya que sus padres eran persona de bajos recursos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Ingeniero forestal.

Con mucho entusiasmo Rogelio trabaja como agricultor, el ha sembrado cacao, plátano y arroz, le dedica su cultivo alrededor de 12 hora al día, ya que es muy cuidadoso; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le gusta lo que hace y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Rogelio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, asimismo realizar el arado de la tierra entre otros, de esta manera el podrá tener una buena cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder tener mas sembríos”.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 30 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  This city is known for its warm and welcoming climate.  It is also known for its beautiful landscape and its wonderful flora and fauna.  The local people are generous and friendly.

Rogelio is a very hard-working man but, whenever he has a little free time, he really enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes: 'aguadito de pollo' (Peruvian chicken soup).  Rogelio only studied up to the second year of his primary education as he was from a low-income family.  He would have liked to have gone on to become a forestry engineer.

Rogelio puts a lot of enthusiasm into his work as a farmer, growing cacao, bananas and rice.  He works around 12 hours a day on his crops as he gives them a lot of care.  He believes that his business is doing well because he enjoys what he does and because he has a great desire to make progress.

Rogelio is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy manure and fertilizers.  He will also be able to plow his land.  This will ensure he has a good harvest and he will improve his income.  This, in turn, will allow him to continue working hard toward his biggest dream: to have more crops.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru:
Бактыгул 57 лет. Бактыгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2004 году с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 3 дойные коровы с приплодом, 2 лошади, 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Также Бактыгул обрабатывает 1,20 га земли, где выращивает ячмень, картофель и эспарцет, который служит кормом для скота. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а в этом году хотела бы провести небольшой ремонт дома.
texts.en: Baktygul is 57 and works in crops and livestock, which is her family's main source of income.  She started this business in 2004 with 10,000 som (KGS) and thanks to her hard work, she now was three dairy cows with calves, two horses, 15 sheep and goats, and her monthly income is now approximately 10,000 som (KGS).  Baktygul also works 1.2 hectares of land on which she grows barley, potatoes and sainfoin, which she uses as feed for the cattle.  To ensure the further development of her business, she has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to fatten and resell.  Baktygul plans to use the remaining money from the loan to invest in the development of her business, and she would like to make some small home repairs this year.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos, 33 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, casado, padre de 4 hijos tres de ellos están en la escuela y el menor aun no pues solo tiene 2 meses de nacido. El junto con su familia habitan en San Lorenzo una comunidad  en las afueras de Teustepe municipio de Boaco.
Él no cuenta con una educación escolar, pues la mayor parte de su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar como la mayoría de las personas en el área rural. Empezó trabajando junto con su padre desde los 11 años de edad, aprendió las labores de siembra y crianza de ganado. Actividades que hoy realiza de manera independiente, sus cultivos principales son el maíz y el frijol.  Está requiriendo financiamiento para comprar insumos, abonos, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para sembrar maíz y frijol. Esto le ayudara a darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos , la cual espera vender a un buen precio que le permita cubrir los costos, invertir de nuevo para ir ampliando poco a poco sus áreas de siembra.
texts.en:
33-year-old Carlos is a farmer.  He is married and the father of four children.  Three of his children are in school but not the youngest because he is only 2 months old.  Carlos and his family live in San Lorenzo, a community which is located on the outskirts of Teustepe, in Boaco municipality.

Carlos did not attend school as he has spent most of his life working like most other people in his rural area.  He started working with his father when he was 11 years old, learning how to sow crops and raise livestock.  He now does this work on his own.  His main crops are maize and beans.

Carlos needs a loan to buy supplies, manure and fertilizers.  He will also pay workers to sow maize and beans.  This will help him to provide better care for his crops which he hopes to sell for a good price so that he can cover his costs and re-invest in his business.  This will enable him to gradually expand the area over which he grows his crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies, manure and fertilizers, and to pay workers to sow maize and beans

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 46 years old and a food kiosk owner in Mombasa. She is married to Jones. She supports her five children who are age 23, 20, 19, 15 and 9 years respectively. She has been operating the food kiosk for the past three years with great success. 

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to renovate her food stall and purchase more chairs and tables. 

She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business further and pay her children’s school fees. She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to renovate her kiosk and purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used his first loan amount to purchase fertilizer. He was able to plant and it was profitable, so he was able to pay all the loan amount well and in good time.

This will be his second loan amount and he plans to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He plans to use the anticipated income to provide for the needs of his family.

In the future, James hopes to improve his farming methods, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Philomenen

texts.en:
Philomenen is 47 years old and is married with four children who are between 12 and 20 years old. She sells beans and maize from a store which operates from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day. She currently employs two people to help her and she has twelve years of experience in this work. 

Philomenen has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more quantities of beans and maize to resell. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs and to pay for medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 28-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. He is married. He has been running his shop business for the past three years with great success. 

This is Reuben’s second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. 

He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business and repay his loan. He hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is now 37 years and is still practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru. This is his eighth year in the same business. His wife and three children are well and the children are still growing. 

This loan will mark his fifth loan with KADET LTD after he repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. 

He hopes to buy a lorry to aid him with transportation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Carmen Alegria

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo, Vive en casa de suegros, los cuales la apoyan en toda actividad que realiza. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Tambogrande. Comunidad urbana que ya cuenta con servicios básicos. 

La actividad que desarrolla Carmen es la venta de ropa, accesorios femeninos y masculinos, hace aproximadamente más de 3 años. Atendiendo todos los días en su propio domicilio y recorriendo a las diferentes zonas cercanas al distrito para lo cual cuenta con clientela establecida. Los ingresos que percibe son para cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia.

Ha solicitado un crédito de 600 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de capital de trabajo para negocio, en la compra de un lote de mercadería (ropa y accesorios), realiza viajes a la ciudad de Piura para hacer las compras. Para eso clienta cuenta con grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 29 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in her in-laws' home and they support her in all her activities.  Their home is located in Tambogrande, in an urban community which has basic services.

Carmen's business is selling clothing and men's and women's accessories.  She has been in this line of work for approximately three years.  She serves customers in her home every day and also travels to different nearby areas where she has an established customer base.  The income that she makes enables her to cover her own expenses and those of her family.

Carmen has requested a loan for 600 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to use as working capital for her business.  She will buy a batch of merchandise (clothing and accessories).  She travels to the city of Piura to make her purchases.  This client has a great desire to make progress and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old and married with two children aged 13 and 7. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 19 years. He is also a wool collector and a sheep broker.

This will be his third term loan with KADET LTD after he repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and to pay laborers on his farm. He plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profits. 

In future, he hopes to be a prominent farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 32-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be an honest, obedient and disciplined man. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. His business goal is to start a new business of electronics sales within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will diversify his business. This is Jackson's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 42 years old and a single mother of two children. She does farming in Olkalau and has been in the business for the past five years.

This will be her third loan and she plans to buy fertilizer and animal feeds. With the anticipated income, she will provide for the needs of her family.

In the future, Veronicah hopes to start a grocery business and sell cereals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah used his previous loan amount to buy clothing materials and sewing threads for use in his business. This enabled him to meet the needs of his clients and it was profitable.

This will mark his fourth loan amount which he plans to use to pay school fees for his child who is in university.

In the future he hopes to grow his tailoring business and make more income.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su familia en casa de sus padres ubicada en el caserío Sialupe Baca de Lambayeque.  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura.

William se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales, desde hace 5 años, tiempo en el cual ha obtenido experiencia en esta actividad.  Sus principales clientes son comerciantes de mercado de Chiclayo y negociantes de la zona.  Adicionalmente trabaja en la fàbrica de sal, donde percibe ingresos semanales.

William ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 3500 nuevos soles, con los cuales desea construir una pieza (cuarto) de adobe al costado del domicilio de su padre, donde habitará junto con su familia de manera independiente.
texts.en:
William is 27 years old and in a common-law relationship.  He lives together with his partner in his parents' home which is located in the small village of Sialupe Baca, in Lambayeque.  The quality of life in this community is one of subsistence.  Most of the locals are self employed.  They have sales businesses and livestock businesses, and also farm.

William has been raising and selling animals for five years.  During this time, he has gained experience.  His main customers are market traders from Chiclayo and traders from his area.  William also works in a salt factory where he earns a weekly wage.

William has requested a loan for 3,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he would like to use to build a room from adobe next to his father's house where he will live independently together with his family.

loans.use: to build a room from adobe where he can live independently with his family

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob used his previous loan amount to buy assorted vegetables to sell in his grocery business. It was profitable and he was able to pay the loan amount well and in good time.

This marks his second loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use it to buy more stock of potatoes, peas and cabbages for resale. He also plans to buy carrots and onions.

In the future, Jacob hopes to grow his business and make more income so as to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, peas and cabbages.

loans.name: Segundo Guido

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 02 hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre del Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en la ganadería. 
Complementariamente es chofer estable en planilla para la congregación FE Y ALEGRIA, en donde tiene trabajando 10 años. Su conviviente cuenta con negocio propio en su domicilio, en el cual vende gaseosas, gelatinas y bodoques. 

Segundo ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para techar 02 dormitorios que ha construido en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Segundo is 40 years old, married, and has two children in his care. He lives in his own home with his wife and his two children. The house is situated in the village of Pueblo Libre in the Tambogrande District.  The client lives in the rural part of the district, but has electrical service.

The activity that he performs is the breeding of smaller livestock (sheep and poultry), which when they reach the ideal weight and size he sells at the local market. He has more than five years of experience in livestock breeding. In addition, he is a regular chauffer for the congregation Fe y Alegría, where he has worked for 10 years. His spouse has her own business in their home, in which she sells soft drinks, gelatins, and bodoques.

Segundo has applied for a loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to roof two bedrooms that he has constructed in his home.

loans.use: to roof two bedrooms that he has constructed in his home.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline has a timber yard business in Nakuru town and it has been profitable.She is 29 years old, married to Samson, and they have three children.

This will be her second loan and she plans to buy more stock of timber to sell. This will enable her meet her clients' demand.

Jackline hopes to buy some land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more stock of timber.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old, married to Jane, and together they have four children. He has been a farmer for the past 16 years, and gets a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from the business. 

This will be his third loan from KADET; he paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and to pay for laborers on his farm. 

He hopes to acquire a bigger loan so that he can purchase another piece of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings, and to pay for laborers

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 50 years old, married to Rosemary, a green grocer, and together they have seven children. He operates a barber shop and has been in the business for the past five years. 

This will be second loan from KADET Ltd. after he paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. He will be using the loan to purchase shaving machines and disinfectants. 

He hopes to expand his business, eradicate poverty in his family and also educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase shaving machines

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-year-old salon owner in Mombasa. She is married and has been running her business for the past two years successfully. 

This marks her second loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase braids, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals and hair rollers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and open another salon. She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals and hair rollers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 34-year-old gentleman. He is married to Lucy and they are blessed with five children aged 10, eight, six, four and two years old. He operates a clothes boutique stall in Bomet area and has been running the business for eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has borrowed his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase more clothing for the business in readiness for the festive season. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for his school-going children.

His dreams are to improve his living standards and own his residential plot.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya in her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

Mose has operates a small kiosk in her house, and for the past three years she has also sold vegetables which provides her other source of income. Mose wants to be able to enlarge her kiosk and have a functioning fast food counter, so that she can continue providing for her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, flour, sugar, tea leaves, and other goods to sell in her kiosk. She and her family appreciate the assistance that they're receiving.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, tea leaves, and other goods.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 31 years old. He is married to Susan and together they have one child aged four years. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past two years.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD after he was introduced by his friend who is a registered KADET client. He will use the loan amount to purchase a stock of rice, cooking fat, sugar and flour to stock in his shop.

He hopes to purchase a taxi vehicle and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice, cooking fat, sugar and flour to stock in his shop.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a woman aged sixty-six. She is married and is a mother of nine children. She buys and sells pigs in Muguga on the outskirts of Kangemi. She has been in this business for twelve years now and she gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Hannah's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy pigs for resale. 

In future she wants to improve her business and move to greater heights.

loans.use: To buy a pig.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 53-year-old mother of four children and has a quarry business in Olkalau town. Her husband is called Stephen and is a farmer.

This is her second loan amount and she plans to use the amount to buy quarry equipment and thereby increase production. She also plans to employ more workers.

In the future, Flora hopes to grow her business and supply building stones and blocks to various places, make more income and being able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy equipment and employ workers.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en:
Salim progressed through the previous loan. He was able to pay school fees for his children and also provide a more comfortable ride to his clients because he repaired his motorcycle. He has also been able to graduate in his loan amount from 400,000 to 700,000 UGX, which will enable him to hire a piece of land to carry out some cultivation. This will expand his income to fully meet his family's needs. 

He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support and believes that with this funding he will achieve his dream of starting a cattle trading business.

loans.use: To rent land for cultivation

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 28 years old and runs a retail shop business in Olkalau town. He is married to Martha and they have one child aged four years.

This is his fourth loan amount and he plans to buy more stock of goods to sell in his shop. These include sugar, rice, bar soap and maize flour.

Geofrey hopes to grow his business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, bar soap and maize flour.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has a retail shop in Naivasha town and has operated it for five years. He is 30 years old, married to Margaret who has a grocery business and they have two children.

This is his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of flour, cooking fat, sugar and milk to resell in his shop. He plans to use the anticipated income to buy a bicycle to supply milk to various customers.

Samuel hopes to grow his business and be able to buy a motorcycle and a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy goods to resell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old and is married, with five children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. He sells various goods, such as beans, rice, sugar, pens, etc. from a store, which operates from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Joseph has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, soft drinks, pens, potatoes,etc. to resell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs, to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, soft drinks, pens and potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been running a carpentry shop in Ndunyu Njeru town and has been in the business for two years. He is 58 years old and is married to Milka who is a farmer.

This is his second loan, and he plans to buy more stocks of timber for making different items of furniture such as tables, beds, chairs and school desks.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his timber and workshop business and supply furniture to different places in the area.

loans.use: To boost business by buying more timber.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 57 years old from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with one child who is 19 years old. Guillerma’s husband is a farmer while she operates a sari-sari store business selling basic household needs like chips, seasoning, canned goods, toiletries and noodles.  

She is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise such as canned goods, toiletries and seasoning. These are the items that are needed by her customers on a daily basis and she knows that if she has enough capital, she can increase her sales and income. In the future, she hopes to be more profitable in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, toiletries and seasoning.

loans.name: Argelia Nohemy

texts.es: Argelia, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Su esposo realiza trabajos de sastrería y de agricultura. Hace 5 años que la señora Argelia decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos para aportar a los gastos del hogar. Ella estableció en su casa una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, embutidos, carnes, lácteos, dulces, churros, cereales, refrescos, huevos, etc. el préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir el negocio de productos alimenticios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar las ventas. Su deseo es que el negocio crezca y se convierta en un mini súper o una abarrotería fuerte.
texts.en:
Argelia, age 36, is married and has two children.  She lives in a village in the Macuelizo municipality in Santa Bárbara.  Her husband does tailoring and farming work.

Five years ago Argelia decided to have her own source of income in order to contribute to the household expenses.  She established a convenience store in her house.  She sells consumer staples like rice, beans, sugar, sausages, meat, dairy products, sweets, churros, cereals, soft drinks, and eggs, etc.

The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use it to stock her business with food products in order to meet the demand from her customers and to increase sales.  Her wish is for her business to grow and become a mini-supermarket or a robust grocery store.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, dairy products, sausages, sweets, and soft drinks, etc, in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Doris Maribel

texts.es:
Doris tiene 29 años y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Puplan en el distrito de Túcume, se encuentra situada en la localidad de Lambayeque, a aproximadamente 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, siempre brindando una buena atención, con lo cual siempre se garantiza una buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su familia y progresar juntos poco a poco.  También se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales.

Doris desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su nivel de venta y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Doris is 29 years old and resides together with her family in the small town of Puplan in the district of Túcume, which is situated in the locality of Lambayeque, approximately 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She makes a living selling essential products and groceries in a small store set up in her home.  There she offers her neighbors all types of products for daily consumption, always providing good attention with which she is always guaranteed a good reception.  The income that she receives from this activity is used to get ahead with her family and progress together little by little.   Also, she makes a living breeding and selling animals. 

Doris wants to purchase more merchandise to be able to increase her level of sales and income, for this reason she has believed it advisable to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles (PEN) that will help her to achieve her objective.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store (rice, noodles, dried vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Phillis is 51 years old and blessed with three children, age 14, 16 and 19. 

She operates a boutique in Magina in the outskirts of Limuru town. Phillis has been in this business for three years now and she gets a monthly income of 24,000 KES.

This will be Phillis' third loan with KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to buy clothes for resale. In future, she wants to become a successful business woman in Limuru.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 26 years old. He is married to Irene and together they have two children, age 11 and 12 years.

He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for eight years.

This is his third loan from KADET Ltd. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow to boost his milk produce.

He hopes to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en: Demetria is 55 yeard old with two adult children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. Demetria has a business selling Natasha and Sundance products like trendy shirts and cosmetics. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like lotion, shirts and perfume. She knows that with a little help through a loan, she can improve her business. In the future, she hopes to have more products to sell for an increased profit.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like lotion, shirts and perfume

loans.name: Keila Mariela

texts.es: Keila, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara junto a su conyugue y su hijo. Keila es una persona muy trabajadora, ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace tres años donde vende variedad de comidas  como ser: desayunos, almuerzos, cenas, pollo frito con tajadas, baleadas (de tortilla de harina), tacos, pastelitos de carne y otros. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y cuenta con muy buena clientela. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar una estufa industrial la que le ayudara a cocinar más rápido sus productos y a incrementar la producción, ya que tiene más clientela,  también con la otra parte del préstamo va comprar más insumos para elaborar las comidas. Está contenta porque su negocio está en crecimiento y así va poder tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Keila, age 22, lives in the Ceguaca municipality in Santa Bárbara.  She lives with her husband and son.  Keila is a very hard-working person.  She has had her own business for three years.  

She sells a variety of food like breakfasts, lunches, dinners, fried chicken with fried banana slices, “baleadas” (flour tortilla), tacos, meat pastries, and others.  Her business is set up in her house, and she has a very good clientele.  

She is requesting a loan for 7,000 lempiras in order to buy an industrial stove.  This will help her cook her products more rapidly, and it will increase her production.  She already has more customers.  Also, she will use the other part of the loan to buy more ingredients to make the food.

She is happy because her business is growing.  This way she will be able to have a better life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and supplies (meat, vegetables, flour, lard, condiments, and others)  to make food to sell.

loans.name: Mastamet

texts.en:
Mastamet is 40 years old, married to Jane, and blessed with five children. 

He has run a health clinic for the past three years in the Ilmotiok area, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

This is his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, with which he intends to purchase additional drugs for the clinic. He plans to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. His future plan is to become a large-scale health provider.

loans.use: To purchase clinical drugs.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, 25, is married, has one young child and lives with his family in their own house in the coastal region of Kenya. He runs a vegetable stall, selling to the neighborhood.

He is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, such as pineapple, bananas, tomatoes, onions, kale and oranges. The loan will enable him to buy the merchandise. He goes to the municipal market every week for his purchases.

The challenges he is up against are the high prices of the products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, such as pineapple, bananas, tomatoes, onions, kale and oranges.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a 71-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has operated a sari-sari store for income for 20 years now. All her 7 children are grown and she is doing business so she can support herself.  Francisca is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as toiletries, sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, noodles, canned goods and eggs. In the future, she hopes to retire from working hard and enjoy life her golden years in comfort.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as toiletries, sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, noodles, canned goods and eggs

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Fifty-five-year-old Teofila is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with 9 children. Her eldest is 36 and the youngest is 14. She works hard in the field to support her family. She grows rice for an income. Teofila is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm so she can have a good yield in her farming. She is confident that good harvest is attributed to fertilizer use. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm so she can have better profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en: Rudelyn is 32 years old, with an 8 year old daughter to look after. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. Rudelyn relies on making dried fish and salted fish for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish to process as well as salt needed for her business. The loan will allow her to sustain her business and support her child. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and venture into other opportunities to generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to process and salt

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 44 years old from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 7, 12 and 20. She has been engaged in the fishing business for 8 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fish hooks, fishing net, gasoline, and rice for his family’s consumption. Marissa’s income provides for her family’s needs like food and school fees. In the future, she hopes to continue her fishing business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish hooks, fishing net, gasoline, and rice for her family’s consumption.

loans.name: Juan Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 27 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, algodón, entre otros. Juan es muy trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquisimo “Arroz Chaufa”. 

Con mucho esfuerzo Juan logro estudiar la carrera técnica de computación e informática y luego de mucha lucha y sobre todo ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de sericio de cabinas de internet, el labora alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un maquina fotocopiadora y realizar un mantenimiento a las computadoras que tiene en su negocio, de esta manera el podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y ofrecer más servicios y mejorar sus ingresos, así el podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Juan, 27, lives in Ica, a city know for its mild and pleasant climate.  The area is famous for the crops produced here: asparagus, grapes, cotton, etc.  Juan is a hard worker, but he takes time now and then to enjoy himself.  He especially likes "arroz chaufa", a traditional rice dish.

Juan worked hard to complete a course in computing and information technology.  He then saved enough to start an Internet cafe business.  He works around 12 hours a day and sees up to 20 customers.  He says that the business is a success because he takes care of his customers and because he has worked hard to make it a success.  

Juan says that he is grateful to Kiva lenders because your help will allow him to buy a photocopier and pay to maintain his computers.  The investment will allow him to provide a better service and, in turn, increase his income.  For the future, he wants to fulfill his dream of "owning my own house".

loans.use: to buy a copier for his office services business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 28-year-old lady and married to Terer. She operates a shop where she sells mobile phone accessories in the outskirts of Limuru town and has been doing so for five years now. Naomi gets a monthly income of 38,000 shillings. 

This will be Naomi's third loan with KADET Ltd. which she plans to use to buy mobile phone accessories. 

In the future she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy moblie phone accessories

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old. He is from Olkalou, is married, and has children who are all in school. 

Joseph has been a farmer for many years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy fertilizers and sheep to add to his livestock. 

He hopes to venture into livestock rearing in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and sheep

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 29 years old. He is married to Emily and together they have two children aged six and four. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past five years. 

This is his first business loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to purchase more rice, sugar and cooking oil for his shop. He hopes to open a boutique for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar and cooking oil for his shop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old, married to Jackson, and together they have five children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years. 

This will be her third loan from KADET after she paid her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer for use in this planting season. She hopes to purchase another farm so that she can expand her farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old married lady who is blessed with two children, age 6 and 4 years. 

She operates a green grocer shop in the Majengo area of Narok town and has been running the business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has borrowed a second loan of KES 75,000 from KADET Ltd., with which she intends to purchase more vegetables for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children.

Her dreams is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Majimbo

texts.en:
Majimbo is 38 years old, married, and  lives in coast province.

She has a grocery store. She is requesting this loan to buy oil, a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, soap and balers of flour. With the help of this loan, she will be able to increase her business. She will make her purchases in the city.

Her dream is to have a bigger retail shop in future.

loans.use: to buy oil, a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, soap and balers of flour.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She sells second-hand shoes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand shoes. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to open up another boutique.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (father). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but has no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Janet sells secondhand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 2 years and works 6 days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used clothes from the United Kingdom.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Josefina
