texts.en: Josefina is a 60-years-old woman who operates a Sari-sari store from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has 6 children who are already grown. Her business started 3 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy stocks like seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs and feed. She hopes to have enough savings so she can live comfortably. In the future, she plans to make her store bigger so she can earn a better profit.

loans.use: to buy stocks like seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs and feed.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita is 58 years old from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has two adult children. Julita is engaged in selling herbal and Chinese medicine for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy more inventory of Chinese medicine that she can resell for a profit. The income will help buy food and pay for household bills. The loan will help a lot so she can improve her business. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business that will allow her to earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of Chinese medicine.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is 23 years old old from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. He has two children ages 3 and 4 whom he supports through fishing. He usually catches squid. He is asking for a loan to buy more fishing hooks and gasoline needed for daily fishing. He is working hard so that he can support the needs of his young children. In the future, he hopes to send them to school.

loans.use: to buy more fishing hooks and gasoline needed for daily fishing.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 44 years old from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with eight children. Her youngest is four and the oldest is 18. Merlita is engaged in the fishing business with her husband.  She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net so they can catch more using new ones.  She is working hard so she can provide for her family’s needs. 

The loan will be the means for them to be more productive with their only source of income. In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business by having another fishing boats.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 43-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children ages two and six. Her husband works as a mechanic. Mirasol also farms rice and grows vegetables to help in raising her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and tools for her vegetable garden. 

The loan will help a lot so she can improve her business. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business that will allow her to earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and tools.

loans.name: Bon Semeur Baco Group

texts.en:
Bon Semeur is a Community Bank made up of seven micro entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Charlotte. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Charlotte operates a drugstore in the northeastern area of Lubumbashi. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of three children between 14 and 22 years old. She started her business in 1993 with the beginning capital of US $50. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, Charlotte’s business has prospered and has permanent customers to keep it up. It generates US $150 of profit per week. 

Charlotte is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having 12 times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She is planning with the new loan to expand her business by buying more medicine needed by her customers. Her ambition is to open another drugstore.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her drugstore by buying medicine needed by her customers.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, and one of her children goes to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water nor to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She sells cassava chips and samosa at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more cooking oil and baking flour and cassava. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to become a wholesaler, employ two girls to assist in her work and also to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and to pay for labor to make her business a success. This way she can better provide for her family. In the future she would like to cultivate a bigger farm for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and labor.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a 47-year-old father of three children.  All of them attend school.

He is a butcher as well as a farmer on his banana plantation.  He started this business 10 years ago with the main reason of providing quality education for his children.  Now he needs a loan to pay for his children's school before his harvest comes in later on.  Benon's dream is to be able to have many more cows so that his life will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol is 28 years old from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two children ages two and four. She supports her family by helping her husband in their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy fish nets, gasoline, fish hooks and rice for consumption. She hopes to have other business options in the future so she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, fish hooks and rice.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be an honest and obedient woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy clothes for selling. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business. Annah is on her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be a determined and goal-oriented woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, flour, maize flour etc. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation which she uses when getting household items from the wholesalers. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy household items. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household items for resale

loans.name: Silipi

texts.en: Silipi is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows round cabbages, beans, carrots, green peppers, and eggplant to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Silipi has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, hose, wheel barrow, weed chemicals, spades, and insect chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Silipi hopes to improve her business, her kids' educations, and her family affairs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, wheel barrow, gloves, and other farming supplies

loans.name: Apaua

texts.en: Apaua is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells donuts, pork buns, biscuits, and Chinese cake in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Apaua needs a loan to buy bags of flour, bag of sugar, oil, soy sauce, and onions. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her family matters. Apaua has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, baking soda, cooking oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Lesalautofa

texts.en: Lesalautofa  is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Lesalautofa needs a loan to buy more flour, onions, soy sauce, pork, and garlic. She plans to use her profits to improve her business, to provide her kids with an education, and to address family matters. Lesalautofa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pork buns

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra del  Socorro de  57años de edad casada con  12  hijos de 42,40,37,36,35,33,31,29,27,25,23,19. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega. Tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería, nacatamales, mercadería en general, tamales de elote, güirila, elote cosidos todos estos son comidas típicas de nuestro país  elaborado de maíz. El negocio es prácticamente familiar ya que trabajan algunos de sus hijos, y juntos han hecho de este negocio una alternativa de empleos sostenible. El negocio está ubicado en  su casa de habitación y tiene vendedores ambulantes. Sandra cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años. El negocio lo aprendió como una iniciativa propia ya que no tenían trabajo ella ni el esposo y decidieron  hacer nacatamales los fines de semana y el esposo los vendía de forma ambulante. Posteriormente decidieron realizar otras actividades comerciales en toda la semana  como vender güirila, elotes cosidos, tamales de elotes de dicha forma fueron ampliando su negocio. Sandra ya ha realizado créditos con fundación  y ha demostrado ser responsable, de sus pagos en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en la compra de maíz, para realizar las comidas típicas antes señaladas, mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos, productos lácteos. Sandra agradece la ayuda que le  brindan  los  inversionistas kiva a pequeños comerciantes  de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Sandra del  Socorro is 57 years old. She is married and has 12 chidlren, aged 42, 40, 37, 36, 35, 33, 31, 29, 27, 25, 23, 19. she is from the departament of Chinandega. Her economic activity is a store where she sells general merchandise and nacatamales, sweet corn tamales, corn pancakes, and cooked sweet corn- all traditional food from our country. The business is practically a family business since some of her children work there. Together they have made this business a sustainable alternative of employment. The business is located in her house and she has street vendors. Sandra has 6 years experience. She learned the business on her own intitiative since they had no work and her husband didn't either. They decided to make nacatamales on the weekends and her husband sold them as a street vendor. Later they decided to do other commercial activities during the week, such as selling corn pancakes, cooked sweet corn, and sweet corn tamales. In this way, they expanded their business. Sandra has already taken out loans with the foundation and has shown herself to be responsible with making her payments on time. The purpose of the loan  is to invest in buying corn to make the previously mentioned traditional foods and general merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics, and dairy products. Sandra is thankful for the help from the Kiva investors for small businesspeople with low income in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her store and buy products to sell nacatamales, general merchandise, mercadería en general, sweet corn tamales, corn pancakes, and cooked sweet corn.

loans.name: Danfer Ismael

texts.es:
Danfer es un joven de 19 años de edad,, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, y también es conocida por los exquisitos platos típicos de la ciudad. Danfer es un joven trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho pasar un tiempo con su familia ya que el vive al lado de su pareja con la cual tiene un pequeño de un año de edad, por el cual él tiene una razón para seguir adelante a pesar de las adversidades. 

Día a día Danfer trabaja como repartidor de bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral, entre otros, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque necesita salir adelante por su familia.

Danfer está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar esteras, maderas, calaminas, para poder construir un cuarto, ya que los padres de su esposa le han brindado un espacio para poder vivir, de esta manera podrá tener un lugar donde vivir y poco a poco poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Danfer, 19, lives in Chincha, a city known for its mild and pleasant climate.  The city is also famous for its many sporting successes and for its traditional cuisine.  Danfer has to work hard, but he takes time now and then to be with with his family.  He lives with his wife and their year-old child.  As a dad, he has double the reason to work hard and overcome whatever obstacles stand in his way.

Danfer has a job delivering soft drinks, mineral water, etc. He works every day, for 10 hours a day, to support his family.  He says that he is good at his job because he is responsible and, above all, because, he has to make a success of it to take care of his family.  

Danfer says that he is grateful to Kiva lenders because your loans will allow him to buy the construction materials--flooring, roofing, timber, etc.--he needs to add a room to his wife's parents' house.  His wife's parents have set aside space for the room and he only needs the materials to build it.  The investment will provide him and his family with a place to live and work toward his dream of "giving our child a good education and owning a house of our own".

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a house improvement project.

loans.name: Progresando En Valores 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of her group, Progresando en Valores 1, 2 & 3 (Progress in Values). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to finish building her house. She has been building her home little by little, adding rooms and finishing last details. In the meantime, she continues to enjoy sewing.

Ysabel is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza. She has had her business, which she started with some savings, for almost five years. She plans to use this loan to increase her inventory by buying men's and women's clothes. She will use the profits to continue building her house. Her dreams are to work hard and move her business forward, and with the help of God, she will. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes and other used items for resale

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en: Concepter is a married woman with 3 children whose ages range from 2 years to 7 years. She describes herself as a patient, honest, and caring woman. For two years, she has operated a stall where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her business is located within an open-air market and her primary customers are area residents. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. Concepter will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. Her business goal is to run another grocery store within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Before starting her grocery business, Concepter worked at an M-pesa outlet kiosk.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 3 children whose ages range from 9 years to 18 years. He describes himself as an honest, friendly, and opportunistic man. For the last 23 years, he has operated a retail business where he sells shoes. His business is located in a strategic, busy commercial area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. Daniel will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy leather, shoe laces, and adhesive for making new shoes to sell. He looks forward to running another retail shoe business in the future. He also hopes to be able to educate his children with his profits.

loans.use: to buy leather, shoe laces, and adhesive for making shoes

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Luisa Amanda de  71 años de edad  madre soltera con  3 hijos de edades comprendida de 53, 50,30, años  todos independientes económicamente. El negocio consiste en vender productos reciclados  como electrodomésticos nuevos y usados, adornos de todo tamaño. Tiene 16 años de experiencia y está ubicado en su casa de habitación y de forma ambúlate. La rutina diaria de  la Sra. Luisa es de 8 horas diaria. El negocio lo inicio como una alternativa de vida para no depender económicamente de nadie y tener un ingreso propio para vivir, con un poco de fondo propio y en su momento para mantener a sus hijos. En la actualidad su carga familiar se ha disminuido ya que todos son independientes. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio para brindarles mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias. Luisa agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a las  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como Nicaragua.
texts.en: Luisa Amanda is 71 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children, aged 53, 50, and 30. All of them are financially independent. The business consists of selling recycled products, such as new and used appliances, and all sizes of decorations. She has 16 years experience and her business is located in her house. She also sells in the street. Luisa's daily routine is working for 8 hours. She started the business as a way to not depend financially on anyone and have an income to live on as well as support her children. Right now her family responsibilities have gone down since everyone is on their own. The purpose of the loan is to invest in her business and stock it to offer a better service to her customers and increase her earnings. Luisa is thankful for the support from the Kiva investors for low income people in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy and sell recycled, second hand applicances and decorations.

loans.name: Armando Juan

texts.es:
Armando tiene 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa en Cayalti, el lugar ha experimentado un incremento en su actividad comercial durante los últimos años. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de verduras al por mayor y menor en un puesto de venta dentro del Mercado de la zona, adquiere su mercadería muy temprano a los distribuidores que llegan a su centro de abastos para luego ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes, en su mayoría vendedores de mercados minoristas. Se ha hecho conocido en el rubro gracias a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes.

Armando desea incrementar su negocio y para ello ha creído pertinente aumentar su nivel de inventario, específicamente comprar más verdura para venderla, esto producto a la alta demanda detectada.  Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Armando is 64 years old and lives with his wife in Cayalti. The place has seen an increase in commercial activity in recent years. It is located about an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He sells vegetables, wholesale and retail, in a stall in the market in the area. He gets his merchandise very early to distributors so that it reaches the wholesale food market to give the merchandise to their clients, mostly retail market vendors. He has become known in the business thanks to the good care he provides his customers.

Armando wants to increase his business and believes it’s appropriate to increase his level of inventory, specifically to buy more vegetables to sell as this product is of high demand. To reach his goal he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a married man with 2 children, aged 9 months and 4 years. He describes himself as a patient, determined, and honest man. He operates a tailoring business where he sells clothing. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a potentially strategic area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving his business. William will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. His business goal is to buy five more sewing machines within the next five years in order to meet the increasing demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his tailoring business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man with 4 children between the ages of 2 years and 10 years. He describes himself as a determined and focused man. He operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea, and snacks. His business is located in a fast-growing urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lacking a good Thermos to keep tea warm for his customers. He will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy a thermos flask (tea mug) and ingredients to prepare food. His business goal is to run a real estate business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his business, earning more profits so he can employ his wife at the restaurant and educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and a Thermos flask for his restaurant

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a 27-year-old married man with one child. He describes himself as warm and determined. He operates a motorcycle transportation service. His business is located in a competitive commercial environment and his primary customers are members of the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as weather changes, especially hot and rainy days. Boniface will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be a financially stable man. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and lives in Pulot, Ozamiz City. She is married with two adult children. Rowena is engaged in food vending in her barangay [village]. She's requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase raw ingredients for her banana cue business. 

Rowena has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. She hopes to expand her business and put up a food stall in the public market of Ozamiz City.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her banana cue vending.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.en: Hermes is a 42-year-old man from Antequera, Bohol. He currently sells gasoline along the highway and prepaid cellphone services through electronic reloading. Hermes is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline and prepaid loads to accommodate his customers' requests. He believes that an investment of additional capital will increase his income. He hopes that, in the future, he can venture into other business opportunities for better profits.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline and prepaid cellphone loads

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Mary is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself as a determined woman. Mary operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her salon is located in a business area with potential, and her primary customers are students and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as delayed payments from customers. Mary will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products for the salon. Her business goal is to own two more beauty salons within five years, in order to meet customer demand. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to pay school fees for her children and run a beauty school. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 30-year-old married man. He has 2 children aged 2 years and 7 years. He describes himself as honest and warm. James operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a viable commercial environment, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest challenge as stiff competition within the area. He will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for resale. His goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business by restocking his inventory.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 44 years old and lives in Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with seven children. To earn a living, Shirly has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Shirly has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Shirly has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Shirly would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres, asimismo se bailan danzas típicas de nuestro país como lo es el festejo, landó, zamacueca, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Juane”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Economía.

Día a día Carmen trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, y también trabaja en un fundo agrícola como obrera, ella labora en el fundo alrededor de 9 horas al día y aprovecha para ofrecer sus productos de belleza a sus compañeras de labores; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo  porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo responsable.

Carmen está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como ropa para damas caballeros y niños, así como perfumes, cremas, labiales, entre otros; de esta manera tendrá mas productos para ofrecer y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder seguir mejorando”.
texts.en:
Carmen, 34, lives in Chincha, a city known for its mild climate and friendly people.  Local dance traditions are also alive and well here.  The festejo, lando, zamacueca and other dances are typical of this area.  Carmen likes to listen to music in her spare time.  She also tells us that she likes a popular local dish called "juane".  She would have liked to have studied economics, but she wasn't able to finish school because her family didn't have the money to pay the fees.

Carmen has a small beauty products business.  She also works 9 hours a day at a "fundo agricola" [not sure--a food processing plant, perhaps?].  Some of her co-workers there are also customers of her beauty products business.  She says that she is successful at work because she is friendly and responsible.  

Carmen says that she is grateful to Kiva lenders because your loans will allow her to stock her business with clothing--for men, women and children--and beauty products--perfumes, creams, etc.--that she will then resell.  The investment will allow her to expand her business and, in turn, increase her income.  Her dream, she says, is to "provide my children with a good education and get ahead in the world".

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 52 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Francisca is engaged in a farming business – particularly in rice production – and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase fertilizers for her farming activity. 

Francisca has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Francisca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to be used to purchase fertilizers for her farming activity

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 61 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 
Leonila has a store that sells consumable products. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippine Peso) to purchase more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.
Leonila has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is 29 years old and lives in San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is single.
Benjie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for two years. He has requested this loan for additional capital.
Benjie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Benjie hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: 0404016 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trọng operates a business catching fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Trọng faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to to purchase a net to fish. 

Trọng is 45 years old and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province with one dependent; three others are grown up. In the future, Trọng hopes for her children to do well in school. She wants to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business.

In 2002, Trọng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Trọng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mrs. Trọng is the leader of a four member group, the 404016 Hoang Hoa solidarity group.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gladys de 47 años, se dedica a la venta de comida y al mismo tiempo tiene una pulpería, habita en la Ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 19 y 14 años de edad ambos están estudiando. 
Su actividad la empezó hace 10 años , como una forma de ganarse la vida por sí misma y no depender de nadie, además de pensar en los estudios de sus hijos que es primordial para ella, estos requiere de ingresos. La venta de comida fue su primer negocio producto de su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado poner también una pequeña pulpería. Actualmente sobrevive de estos dos negocios y sus hijos la apoyan. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, pollo, carne, verduras. Esto le permitirá materia prima para hacer sus comidas y también invertir en productos para su pulpería. Su expectativa es hacer crecer su pulpería y que su negocio de comida atraiga más clientela.
texts.en: Gladys is 47 years old, she works selling food and at the same time she has a grocery store. She lives in the city of Managua and she has two children who are 19 and 14 years old who are both in school. She began her business 10 years ago as a way to earn a living for herself and to not be dependent on anyone. Moreover, she was thinking of the studies of her children, which is fundamental for her, and these require earnings. The sale of food was her business product. Through her own effort and dedication she has also been able to establish a small grocery store. Now she survives through these two businesses and her children support her. She seeks the loan to buy basic grains, chicken, meat and vegetables. This will provide her with primary materials to make her meals and also to invest in products for her grocery store. Her expectation is to make her grocery store grow and that her food sale business will attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat and vegetables. This will provide her with primary materials to make her meals and also to invest in products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with one child. Jocelyn is 35 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Jocelyn has a general store and eatery business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP (Philippine Peso). Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.
In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages

loans.name: 030104 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huê operates a fishing business. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Huê is 52 years old and she is married with three children.   Huê is the group leader of the her Hoang Hoa solidarity group, which consists of five members.  She supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Another child is grown up.

In 2001, Huê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that Huê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huê hopes to maintain  a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Agar

texts.en:
Agar is 54 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependent. 
Agar has a general store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP (Philippine Peso) to be used in purchasing more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.
Agar has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Agar hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
Gemma is engaged in a fish and dried fish vending business and earns approximately 2,500 PHP (Philippine Peso) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional fresh fish and dried fish for sale. 
Gemma has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Gemma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to be used to purchase additional fresh fish and dried fish

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 62 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela. He is widowed with five children. Wilfredo has a tailoring shop. He has had this business for 20 years. Wilfredo requested a loan to purchase additional materials for his clothing business. 

Wilfredo has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Wilfredo hopes to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his clothing business

loans.name: 0403013 Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyên has a fishing business. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to catch fish.

Duyên is 43 years old and she is married with three children.  She is the leader of a four member Hoang Hoa solidarity group. Duyên  supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Another child is grown up.

In 2005,  Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Duyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Duyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain its success, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to catch fish.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is 63 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married and the mother of three children. To earn a living, she sells a variety of food for snacks. She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work, and is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more foods to cook and sell. Florita has been a member of PMPC for one year. Her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Odili

texts.es: Odili, es ama de casa  y comerciante es dueña de una pequeña pulpería , es originaria de Estelí  donde habita junto con su mama y dos hijos. Esta actividad la empezó hace 6 años, anteriormente era su mama quien se dedicaba atender el negocio pues fue con capital de ella que la pulpería se logró establecer. Actualmente Odili es quien es la que mantiene el negocio y los gastos del hogar, prioriza los estudios de sus hijos. Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, productos de limpieza y también invertir en comprar ropa para vender. Esto como una manera de ir vendiendo nuevos productos en  su pulpería. La cual espera ir ampliando más, introduciendo nuevos productos que le permita hacer crecer y mejorar los ingresos para vivir de manera digna.
texts.en:
Odili is a housewife, businesswoman, and is owner of a small grocery store.  She is originally from Esteli where she lives with her mother and two children.  Previous to managing the business six years ago, her mother was responsible for running the store and it was with her money that the business was established. 

Now, Odili is the one who manages the business and home expenses - she prioritizes her children's study costs.  She is seeking funding to purchase basic grains, cleaning products, and clothes to sell.  This way she will be able to sell new products at her store which she hopes to keep expanding by introducing new products that allow her to grow and increase her income thus giving her a better lifestyle.

loans.use:
to purchase basic grains,  cleaning supplies, and clothes.

para comprar granos básicos, productos de limpieza y ropa.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 67 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children

Jesusa is engaged in the hog raising business and earns approximately PHP 4,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to be used in purchasing feed for her hogs. 

Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Jesusa hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Leygie

texts.en: Leygie is married and the mother of three children. She is 44 years old and lives in the 50th Brgy, Ozamiz City, where she earns a living by selling cloth. She has been in this line of work for two years, and earns PHP 3,000 a month. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy more materials for her clothing business. Legie has been a member of PMPC for four years, and her goal for the future is to improve her living situation and meet all of her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy materials for her clothing business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 28 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married, the mother of one child and makes a living by raising hogs. She earns about PHP 2,000 a month and is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy feed which she will use to fatten her hogs. Emily has been a member of PMPC for one year and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en: Arlen is married and the mother of four children. She is 34 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, where she earns a living by selling dresses. She has been in this line of work for three months, and is now earning about PHP 2,000 a month. She is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more dresses to sell to her customers. Arlen has been a member of PMPC for one year and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dresses to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 50 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. She is married with three children. Alma has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for six years. 

Alma requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Alma has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Alma hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 70 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 12 children.
 
Leonila is engaged in a nipa leaf weaving business and earns approximately  PHP 1,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional nipa leaves for use in her business. 

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa palm leaves.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is 68 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban with her husband and five children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by running a general store where she sells a variety of products. She is requesting a loan to buy more items, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents, to sell to her customers. Margarita has been a member of PMPC for 10 months and is hoping to earn enough money to set aside some funds to use in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eder Maurinho

texts.es:
Eder vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo sus pobladores son personas son muy amables y sobre todo generosas. Eder vive al lado de sus esposo, con quien tiene dos pequeño, los cuales son gemelitos y son recién nacidos; los cuales se han convertido en el regalo más grande que Dios le ha podido dar  por ello nos comenta Eder que trabajara muy uro para poder ofrecerles una vida digna y sobre todo para que sean mejores que el.  Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta jugar futbol con su amigos y vecinos de su barrios, pero en ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “pescado Frito”. 

Con  mucho entusiasmo Eder trabaja en una empresa como soldador, el labora alrededor de 10 horas diarias y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y hacer las cosas con muchas ganas.

Eder está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado el podrá construir un pequeño cuarto para sus pequeños ya que la vivienda donde vive actualmente es de adobe, lo que le permitirá poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Eder lives in the Parcona district in Ica, Peru. The district of Parcona is known for its warm and friendly climate. Furthermore, its inhabitants are very kind and above all, generous people.  Eder lives next to his spouse, with whom he has two little ones who are newborn twins. They have become the greatest gift that God has given him and for this reason, Eder tells us that he will work very hard in order to offer them a worthy life and above all to be better than him. When he has a little free time, he likes to play soccer with is friends and neighbors in the area, but on occasion he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, which is the delicious "fried fish" 

With much enthusiasm, Eder works as a welder.  He works around 10 hours daily and with the fruit of his labor, he is able to pay his household expenses. He believes that his work is going well because he works hard to get ahead and does things eagerly. 

Eder is very grateful for the Kiva loans since thanks to the great support that they have given him, he will be able to construct a small room for his little ones, as the house he currently lives in is made of adobe, allowing him to offer a greater quality of life, and to be able to continue fighting each day to make his greatest dream a reality: "to have his own house.

loans.use: to construct a room

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, a 58-year-old mother of five children, is a rural villager from Kandal Province's Kandal Stoeung district. In this area, rice farming is a common business -- in this neighborhood, as well as for Touch. She has been growing rice for 33 years. 

Now, as a first-time borrower, Touch and her fellow group member are seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Touch is a leader of this group. She and her co-member are seeking the same loan amount for the same purpose: to purchase below-the-ground material in the amount of 160,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each for building a decent latrine for their respective families. 

She hopes that this purchase will enable her to have a complete set of latrine material so she can own a hygienic latrine to promote good health practices for her family.

loans.use: To buy below-the-ground material for latrine construction.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru: Инна уже пользовалась кредитами от КИВА, вложив предоставленные средства в развитие своего бизнеса и получение дополнительной прибыли. В этот раз полученные от КИВА средства в размере 4 000 гривен она планирует использовать на закупку партии колгот. Стоимость каждой единицы от 10 до 20 грн.
texts.en: Inna has already taken out a loan from Kiva. She invested the loan into growing her business and making extra profits. This time, she plans to invest the 4,000 UAH borrowed from Kiva to buy a batch of tights, the unit price ranging from 10 to 20 UAH.

loans.use: to buy a batch of tights

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 37-year-old farmer in Litein. He is married with four children – three of them of school-going age. He has been farming for the last 10 years. He produces pineapples, tea, onions and milk which he sells to the local market.

Daniel has requested a 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He aspires to build a dairy unit for his cow. He says the income will help him be able to pay school fees for his children. His main challenge is diseases affecting the cows. 

Daniel thanks Juhudi Kilimo for the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a steamer and facial chair for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy masonry tools for a construction business.

loans.name: Finola

texts.en:
Finola is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, where she lives with her family of two children. She has been in active farming for 15 years with milk and tea being her popular farm produce. 

Finola has requested a loan of 41,600 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimoto buy and insure a dairy cow. She remains optimistic and focused on doubling her milk output. She asserts farming provides the income which goes to meeting other basic needs of the family. She notes that the loan will improve her capital base. She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a farmer and the father of six children, four of whom are already schooling. He has been in farming for ten years and currently produces milk and eggs for the local markets. He notes the major challenge in farming is caused by animal diseases.

Alfred has made a loan request amounting to 41,600 Kenyan shillings which he will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to have a farm of four dairy cows and rank among the major suppliers for the two products.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma, de 29 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, es comerciante se dedica vender café molido y ofrecer los servicios de un molino en Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí  donde habita. Inicio con este negocio hace 1 año, con esfuerzo propio y prestamos otorgado por otras instituciones, compro su primer molino para moler granos tales como café, pinol, maíz antes se dedicaba a la elaboración de pan y nacatamales. Con el objetivo de ir ampliando su negocio en otras comunidades solicita un crédito para  comprar un molino de diesel. De esta manera podrá ofrecer este servicio en otras comunidades conseguirá mejores ingresos y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Norma is twenty-nine years old, married, and has three children. She sells ground coffee and also provides a grinding service in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, where she lives. She started this business one year ago, with her own funds and thanks to loans from other institutions. She bought her first grinder, which she uses to grind things such as coffee beans, toasted maize, and sweetcorn. Before that, she used to make bread and natacamales (a Nicaraguan delicacy made of sweetcorn dough and other ingredients wrapped in plaintain leaves). With the objective of reaching other towns, she asks for a loan to buy a diesel-powered grinder. Thus, she will be able to offer this service to other towns, increasing her income and giving her children a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a diesel-powered grinder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy engine oil, filters, shampoo and polisher.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products for a beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla, originaria de Estelí, es comerciante vende ropa, accesorios de fantasía y plata , tiene 3 hijos de 12, 11 y 10 años de edad, todos ellos están en la escuela. Empezó con solo una pequeña vitrina vendiendo joyeros y perfumes, después fue comprando más mercadería como bisutería, ropa y joyas de plata poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su pequeño negocio del cual subsiste y le ha ayudado a conseguir independencia económica. Ella quiere ir comprando  más mercadería para vender durante la época de navidad. Por eso está requiriendo un financiamiento para comprar bisutería, joyas de plata, carteras y ropa. Ya que esto forma parte del inventario que más vende, además tiene como proyecto vender comida por las noches como una forma de conseguir otras ingresos que le ayuden al conseguir un mejor bienestar económico para su familia.
texts.en: Karla, a native of Esteli, is a merchant who sells clothing, costume jewelry, and silver jewelry.  She has 3 children aged 12, 11 and 10 who are all in school.  She started out with only one small glass display case, selling jewelry and perfumes.   Later, she started buying more merchandise such as accessories, clothing and silver jewelry.  She gradually stocked up her small store, and it is still active and is helping her to gain financial independence.  She wants to buy more merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.  To do this, she needs a loan to buy accessories, silver jewelry, wallets and clothing, because this is the type of merchandise that she sells the most.  In addition to this business she also sells food at night, so that she can earn additional income to help her obtain a better level of economic well-being for her family.

loans.use: to buy accessories, silver jewelry, wallets and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy electronics to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jarvin Ramon

texts.es: Jarvin, habitante de la comunidad Jamali, Esteli se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas, granos basicos, tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a esta actividad desde los 16 años de edad. El nos expresa que la yuda recibida de parte de los financiamientos son claves para poder sacar su cosecha a tiempo y darle u buen mantenimiento, ya esto requiere mucho capital y el no tiene. El esta por comenzar la siembra de tomates es por tal motivo requiere un credito para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra. El espera producir una muy buena cosecha y espera sembrar posteriormente chiltomas.
texts.en: Jarvin, resident of the city of Jamali, Esteli, works in agriculture planting vegetables and basic grains. He has 3 children. He has been working in farming for 16 years. He tells us that the help he has already received in the form of previous loans has been crucial for him to make his harvests on time and to ensure he is able to maintain his fields, as this requires significant capital which he does not have. He is about to begin planting tomatoes, and as a result is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy seeds and pay for the labor costs it will require. He hopes to produce a good harvest in order to begin planting new varieties of vegetables afterwards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay for the labor costs to plant a field of tomatoes

loans.name: Anita Maria

texts.es:
Anita inicio hace 2 años y medio con su negocio y lo hizo porque quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, le gusta vender  pantalones, sabanas y cortinas. 
Sale a recorrer por varios sectores, y lo hace en la mañana y en la tarde. Hasta el momento no ha tenido ninguna problema  grave, pero a veces la falta de capital para comprar mercaderia.
Anita está casada tiene una niña de 12 años  que estudia en escuela fiscal su esposo es pescador. Con el préstamo va a comprar ropa, cortinas y sabanas. Unas de sus metas es tener un bazar ya establecido y ya no a salir a recorrer con la mercadería, si no que las personas vayan a su local.
texts.en:
Anita started her business two years and a half ago, and she did it because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She likes to sell pants, sheets and curtains. She goes selling in various sectors, and she does it in the morning and in the afternoon. So far, she hasn't had any serious problem, but sometimes she faces a lack of capital to buy merchandise.

Anita is married and has a 12 year old daughter who is studying in the fiscal school. Her husband is a fisherman. With the loan, she will buy clothes, curtains, and sheets. One of her goals is to have a small store established so she doesn't have to go out with the merchandise. She would like people going to her premises.

loans.use: to buy clothes, curtains and sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy glue and hard paper to make shoe boxes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tires and tubes for a puncture shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and buy new laces.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair her son's truck.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat and rice for selling.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 44 years old and married, with three children.  

To earn a living, he does garbage collection for a fee.  He has employed four people in his business.  He uses his lorry to collect garbage from homesteads and other areas.  Some of the garbage such as plastic containers and paper bags is later recycled.   Michael also does farming to earn extra income.

He hopes to grow his garbage collection business because he values a clean environment.  He has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to repair the lorry that he uses for his business.

loans.use: To repair his lorry for his garbage collection.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 63 years old and married, with eight children.  

To earn a living, she does farming.  She mainly grows strawberries.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management.  She has also learned how to save her money.

Lucy has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy strawberry seeds.

loans.use: To buy strawberry seeds.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 66 years old and has been in farming for 22 years at his rural home.   He lives there with six children, aged between 22 years and seven years. His farm produces milk, peas, kale, cabbages, and maize for the local market.
  
James has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to help him construct a dairy unit for his farm. He says the income will help in educating his children and leave his monthly pension income to meet his family's other basic needs.

James says poor road networks, lack of capital, and undeveloped local markets are his main challenges.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Urcisina

texts.en:
Urcisina is 63 years old from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is married, with two grown children. 

Urcisina is engaged in selling soft drinks and coconut wine in her community for 40 years now. She is asking a loan to buy coconut wine and soft drinks that she can resell for a profit. The loan will serve as additional capital, so she can continue her business and generate profit for her family's basic needs. 

In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger, so she can provide a healthy diet for her family and savings for old age.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is from the town of Loon, in Bohol province. She is married, with two children, ages 18 and 21. 

She is engaged in operating a sari-sari store and an eatery for 20 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy additional items for her store, such as coffee, sugar, and toiletries. Rufa knows the importance of taking risk and continuing to improve to have a better income for her family. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business location that will sell a variety of items for her customers.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, and toiletries

loans.name: Flavia Francisca

texts.es: Flavia, una humilde comerciante, originaria de Granada, se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Negocio del cual se hizo cargo por completo al morir su esposo hace dos años.  Sale a vender dentro y fuera de la ciudad de Granada. Su crédito anterior lo utilizo para la comprar inventario de calzado, en específico botas para varón pues era un pedido que le hicieron sus clientes de la zona norte del país donde es muy solicitado este tipo de calzado. Se acerca las ventas más fuertes del año y ella necesita inventario de zapatos. Por tal motivo requiere financiamiento para comprar calzado para  estudiantes, niños y adultos. De esta manera le permitirá vender más variedad y abastecer más clientes, pues su objetivo es crecer como comerciante y vivir de manera digna.
texts.en:
Flavia, a humble merchant from Granada, sells shoes. This is a business she took over entirely when her husband died two years ago. She goes out to sell both inside and outside the city of Granada. 

She used her previous loan to buy her inventory of shoes, specifically men's boots, as it was an order placed by her customers from the northern area of the country, where this type of footwear is much requested. 

The strongest sales season of the year is approaching, and she needs an inventory of shoes. For this reason she needs credit to buy shoes for students, children and adults. 

This will allow her to sell more variety and supply more customers, as her aim is to grow as a merchant and live decently.

loans.use: To buy shoes for students, children and adults.

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is 50 years old from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is married, with two grown children. 

Rose Mary has a business operating a sari-sari store (general store) in her town. She sells soft drinks, coconut wine, toiletries, seasoning, and canned goods. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice and soft drinks because her customers buy these items in a daily basis. She hopes that this will help, so she can have a better income. 

In the future, she hopes to renovate and improve her inventory level for an increased profit.

loans.use: to buy rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a counter

loans.name: Al-Tawn Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tawn, and it consists of four children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of YER 220,000 from AMB.

Sumia is 34 years old and a married woman, with five children.  She carries a pink color in the photo.   She lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  She is a tailor, and almost all of her clients are woman.

Not long ago she owned a house. She needs to make several improvements, but mainly she wants to buy doors. She doesn't have the money to make the improvements, though, so she's requesting a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to be able to buy doors for her house.

loans.use: to buy doors for her house.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El señor Luis, es agricultor, originario de  la comarca El Rodeo, Estelí. A pesar de su edad, es un hombre muy activo y trabajador disfruta lo que hace, no tuvo preparación escolar pero las circunstancias de la vida le enseñaron a salir adelante con tantas carencias en las que creció. Su anterior crédito lo utilizo para la siembra de maíz pero las altas concentraciones de agua impidieron que lograra vender toda la cosecha pero con lo que logro vender cubrió los costos de producción. Esto no lo desanimo, al contrario lo motivo a seguir trabajando. Él está requiriendo financiamiento para comprar insumos de siembra para cultivar una manzana de maíz y frijol. Espera vender a buenos precios las cosechas y también invertir en la compra de ganado.
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer from the El Rodeo district of Estelí department. Despite his age, he is a very energetic and hard-working man who enjoys what he does. He didn't have formal education, but the circumstances of his life, and the many privations that he grew up with, taught him how to succeed. 

He used the previous loan to plant corn, but the high water levels prevented him from selling all the harvest. But with what he managed to sell, he covered the cost of production. This didn't discourage him; on the contrary, it motivated him to keep working.  

He needs credit in order to buy planting supplies for cultivating a manzana (1.7 acres) of corn and beans.

He hopes to sell the harvests at good prices, and also invest in the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: To buy planting supplies for cultivating a manzana (1.7 acres) of corn and beans.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 49 years old from Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. She is married, with two children ages 2 and 3. 

She has engaged in a sari-sari store business for five years now. She is asking for a loan to improve her level of merchandise to resell. She will use her loan to buy one sack of rice, soft drinks, toiletries, seasoning, and chips. 

She is confident that with hard work and perseverance, she will be able to uplift her family's present living condition. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store for a better income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: G.s. El Paraiso Group

texts.es: EL G.S EL PARAISO Está conformado por  dos integrantes Rosalina Eufemia y Ever Arnoldo, son originarios del municipio de Chinandega, el cual está ubicado en el occidente del país y se caracteriza por ser un zona comercial productiva. Estos integrantes de este grupo se conocen porque son de la misma zona por lo tanto decidieron optar al crédito bajo la modalidad de grupo solidario para ayudarse económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocio. Rosalina Eufemia es la coordinadora del grupo la cual se encarga de las responsabilidad y cumplimiento de pagos en tiempo y forma ella tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería que consisten en vender productos de consumo diario del hogar en cantidades pequeñas como una bolsita de café, bolsita de champo, bolsita de detergente un jabón de lavar ropa, pasta dental, una libra de arroz, ¼ de aceite. y esta  ubicado en su casa de habitación. Tiene 10 años de  experiencia en el negocio. El financiamiento lo quiere para surtir su pequeño negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. EL G.S EL PARAISO agradece a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que le brindan a los comerciantes pequeños de países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en: The EL PARAISO group is made up of two members, Rosalina Eufemia and Ever Arnoldo.  They are originally from Chinandega, which is located in the west part of the country and is known for is productive business zone.  These members know each other because they are from the same zone and therefore they decided to request a group loan so that they could help one another financially and invest in their different businesses.  Rosalina Eufemia is the group’s coordinator and is in charge of making payments.  She has a general store where she sells daily household consumables in small amounts, such as bags of coffee, shampoo, detergent, toothpaste, rice, and cooking oil.  She runs the business out of her home and has been doing so for 10 years.  She wants to use the money from this loan to stock her business so that she can satisfy her customers’ needs.  EL PARAISO is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they give small businesspeople in poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have dignified lives.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, habitante de la comunidad el Espinal en las afueras de Estelí, de oficio agricultor , actividad que realiza desde muy joven por tradición de sus padres. 
Se  está preparándose para el siguiente ciclo de siembra de granos básicos,  para lo cual está requiriendo  financiamiento para adquirir abono, fertilizantes y semillas para el cultivo de 1 manzana de frijoles, siembras que hará junto con sus hijos. El espera una cosecha de muy buena calidad y altos rendimientos.
texts.en:
Juan, inhabitant of the community of Espinal, one of the suburbs of Estelí, is a farmer by trade. He has worked in this activity from a very young age, as this is a tradition from his parents. 

He is preparing for the next cycle of sowing of basic grains for which he needs financing to purchase manure, fertilizers, and seeds for the cultivation of 7,000 square meters of beans, sowings that he will do with his children. He hopes for a crop of good quality and high yields.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, and seeds for the cultivation of 7,000 square meters of beans

loans.name: Shadha Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shadha, which consists of four ladies. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Amh is 42 years old. She is a married woman and is a mother of two children. She is a school teacher. She is the second woman from the right and is carrying a black handbag.

Amh wants to help herself with her work, so she is requesting a loan from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help her to do her school reports. This will ensure a better future for herself and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop for personal use

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 20 years old and a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He intends to work as an accessories vendor. He has a little bit of capital, but actually it is not enough to buy computers and sell them to customers. He is hardworking and he likes his work. 

He would like to ask for financial assistance. So he applied for a youth loan from AMB that will be used to buy computers for his business. 

He believes he could increase his income to cover his family's needs and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy computers for his business.

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal venceremos esta conformados por 8  integrantes de los cuales síes son madres solteras con 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, y dos integrantes varones. Todos pertenecen a la comunidad de malpaisillo lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona agrícola donde se siembras maíz, trigo, y productora de leche. Los integrantes de este banco decidieron unirse para optar al crédito con fundación y salir adelantes con sus diferentes negocios, son personas, trabajadoras, honradas, con ganas de superación y para salir adelante con sus hijos  que tengan mejores oportunidades. Benita es la coordinadora del banco comunal Venceremos la cual se encarga de las responsabilidad de cada  uno de los  integrantes con la puntualidad de  las cuotas en tiempo y forma y que todas se apoyen organizadamente.  Benita  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación y cuenta con una experiencia de  5 anos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir  su pulpería en la compra de productos de consumo diario del hogar como: granos básicos, aceite, pan, leche, huevos, golosinas, tiste, entre otros. Y de dicha forma satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los cuales son sus vecinos, y así poder incrementar sus ganancias. Los integrantes del banco comunal Venceremos agradecen la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a las personas de escasos recurso de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank “Venceremos” (We will conquer) is comprised of 8 members, 6 of whom are single mothers with 10 children to care for. Two members are male. They all belong to the area Malpaisillo that is a place that is characterized as an agricultural zone where one can sow corn and wheat and produce milk. 

The members of this bank decided to unify to obtain credit from the foundation and get ahead in their different businesses. The members are hard working and honorable. They also have hopes of overcoming their situation to get ahead with their children so they can have better opportunities. 

Benita is the coordinator of the community bank ”Venceremos” (We will conquer). She is responsible that each of the members pays their repayments on time and that they all support each other in an organized way. 

Benita has a grocery store located in her house. She has 5 years experience. She needs the loan to invest capital in her work and supply her grocery store with daily necessities such as: basic grains, oil, bread, milk, eggs, delicacies, tiste (corn and cocoa drink) among other things. This way she will satisfy the demand of her clients that are her neighbors and increase her earnings. 

The members of the community bank “Venceremos” (We will conquer) are grateful to the help given to them by the Kiva investors to low income people in underdeveloped countries such as Nicaragua so the members have a dignifying work source.

loans.use: to supply her grocery with products of daily consumption such as basic grains, oil, bread, milk, eggs, and sweets.

loans.name: Huber Josue

texts.es: Huber, es un joven de 23 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Estelí, tiene un hijo de 6 meses de nacido. Trabaja en un taller de pintura y enderezado de vehículos, negocio que inicio su papa pero al cumplir 20 años su padre lo dejo a cargo del taller. Actualmente lleva 3 años dirigiéndolo por cuenta propia, poco a poco tiene la expectativa de ir mejorando las condiciones su humilde taller. Está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar láminas de zinc y material de construcción para reparar el  techo que está muy deteriorado. Pues desea que sus clientes se sientan seguros de dejar sus vehículos resguardados donde preste buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Huber, age 23, lives in the city of Estelí, and he has a six month old son.

He works in an automobile paint and body shop.  His father started the business.  However, when he was 20 years old, his father left him in charge of the shop.  He has now had three years of running it on his own.  Little by little, he expects to improve the conditions of his humble shop.

He is requesting the loan to buy zinc sheeting and construction materials to repair the roof, which has deteriorated a great deal.  He wants his customers to feel secure about leaving their vehicles protected where there are suitable conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 55 years old and married, with three grown children, from Maribojoc town. 

For ten years now, she has run a sari sari store and sold used branded clothing.  She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soft drinks and clothing that she can resell for a profit. She is optimistic that with an additional capital, she can make her business bigger. 

Her income helps in paying the bills and in buying healthy meals. In the future, she hopes to have other business options that will help increase her business profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Amol Group

texts.en:
Amol is a group of three women from Aden, Yemen who are close friends and live in Aden, Yemen. These women sell various items to expand their business. The group members decided to request a loan of 140,000 (YER) from AMB. 

Badria is 32 years old (she is in the middle of the photo) and the leader of this group. She is a married woman and has one child. She has been running a business selling incense, perfumes, and women's bags for 5 years. She would like to expand her business in order to meet her clients' needs. 

Badria requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to invest in buying supplies for her business like perfumes, incense. and other items that will be used to earn more profit. In the future, she would like to expand her business by buying electrical goods and mobiles and selling them around her area.

loans.use: to invest in buying supplies for her business like perfumes, incense, and other items that will be used to earn more profit.

loans.name: Ines Del Carmen

texts.es:
Inés, originaria de Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí, es dueña de una pulpería , la cual tiene en su casa de habitación. La abrió hace 7 años con ingresos que obtuvo trabajando en Costa Rica, luego busco financiamiento para poder surtir un poco más su negocio. Ella nos dice que sin la ayuda de los créditos su negocio no podría crecer, ya que necesita de capital para mantener surtido de producto su  pulpería  además que los clientes siempre están en busca de productos con precios accesible y de consumo alimenticio.
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos al por mayor, productos de limpieza, enlatados, avenas, huevo, pan, papel higiénico, pasta de dientes.  Todos productos de alta demanda y de mucha necesidad en su comunidad. Su idea es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Inés is from Pueblo Nuevo, in Estelí municipality. She owns a small general store that she has in her home. She opened it seven years ago, with income she earned working in Costa Rica. Later she sought credit for stocking her store a bit more. 

She says that without the help of the loans, her business could not grow, as she needs working capital to keep her general store stocked with goods. Her   customers are always looking for food products, and goods at affordable prices. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy basic staples at wholesale, cleaning products, canned goods, oatmeals, bread, toilet paper and toothpaste, all of which are much-needed products in her community and in high demand. Her plan is to convert her general store into a store with a greater variety of goods.

loans.use: To buy basic staples at wholesale, cleaning products, canned goods, oatmeals, eggs, bread, toilet paper and toothpaste.

loans.name: Al-Slam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Slam and consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking and took out a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. The loan will benefit small businesswomen. 

Zainb is one of the group members and she currently has a business sewing ladies clothes. She is standing in the middle of the photo. Zainb is 35 years old and has five children. She comments that she started this business on her own initiative and is doing very well. She was working in embroidery before working in sewing. 

Zainb is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine for her business. The loan will help to increase capital. She dreams of opening a sewing factory to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Hogar De Niños Group

texts.es: Zoila tiene 31 años, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Hogar de Niños, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja de aserrador, sus hijos se dedican a estudiar, es una persona muy honesta y trabajadora. Zoila inicio su negocio hace tres años comenzó con una caceta de venta de comida, actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y sandalias, el negocio lo aprendió de su hermana ya que ella tiene una tienda de ropa, su horario de atención es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm, lo realiza de forma ambulante y sale a vender a barrios y colonias de su comunidad.
