Badru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Badru, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and maize

loans.name: Purreh

texts.en:
Purreh is 57 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children. 

Purreh is engaged in an eatery business and earns approximately 5,000.00 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan to be used in redeeming her mortgaged parcel of cocoland (agricultural property where coconuts grow). Purreh has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Purreh hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming her mortgaged parcel of cocoland (agricultural property where coconuts grow).

loans.name: Gwendolyn's Group

texts.en:
Gwendolyn is 48 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents.
 
Gwendolyn has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

Gwendolyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gwendolyn hopes to expand her business. Gwendolyn is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 61 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. Leonora is widowed with six children. 
Leonora works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. Leonora has been doing this for seven years.Leonora has requested a loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional fishing materials. 
Leonora has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To mulch his bananas, expand his piggery, and buy corn, coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 25-year-old carpenter in Mombasa. He is married to Jacinta. He has done carpentry for the last six years, and he is doing great. 

This is his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase new hammers, nails and chisels. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and repay his loan. 

He hopes to gradually expand his business and be able to support his family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase new hammers, nails and chisels.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en: Vivencia is 60 years old and married. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She has three children who have helped her take care of her banana crop. She has been raising bananas for 10 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Vivencia joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Kasangati region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, posho flour and gnuts. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour, baking flour and cooking oil, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and help her grow her business with the expanded inventory. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to build up rental houses. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour, baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Carmilita

texts.en:
Carmilita is 31 years old and lives in Mayors Village Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 
Carmilita is engaged in business (snack vending) and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12000 PHP to purchase materials for her house repair.
Carmilita  has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Carmilita hopes to expand her business and to finish her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret does farming in Olkalau town, where she plants and sells cash crops such as potatoes, maize and beans. She is 48 years old and married to Obadia, who is also a farmer. They have six children.

This will be her second loan amount, and she plans to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use in her farm during this planting season.

She hopes to improve her farming methods and make more income so as to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 52 years old. He is married to Mary and together they have two children aged 20 and seven years. He sells goats and has been in the business for the past 22 years, making a great income.

This is his first business loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase more goats for resale in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to fatten and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Kasangati region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past four years, Annet has been working hard to manage her hardware shop, which sells cement, iron sheets and bars. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more iron sheets, wire mesh, rings and cement, and will help Annet to generate greater profits, improve her standards of living, and pay for family necessities. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to build up a permanent house on her mortgage. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets, wire mesh, rings and cement

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is married with two children. She is 33 years old and lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. Lily owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting cassava to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years and earns 6,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Lily has become a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, just this year. In the future, Lily's plan is to save her returns in order to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her depot, which sells beer and wine. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks in bulk to sell, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and grow her business with the increased sales. Rebecca hopes that, in the future, she will be able to sell quality products. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: For over five years in Labo, Ozamis City, Thelma, a 50-year-old married mother of four children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month this way. In 2007, Thelma joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, beans, posho, and other general items. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and other commodities, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and enlarge the business with proceeds from increased sales. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to sell quality products. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and other commodities

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 36-year-old businesswoman who sells second-hand clothes in Mombasa. She is a married mother of three school-going children. She has been running a second-hand clothes retail stall for the last four years and she is doing great. 

This will be Francisca’s second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more second-hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, George has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells posho, rice, sugar, and other commodities. 

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda, posho, bread, and other goods, and will help George to generate greater profits and help him grow the business with increased sales. George hopes that in the future, he will be able to sell quality products in a larger business. 

George is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more soda, posho, bread, and other goods

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 43 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with five children. 

She has had a store selling a variety of products for seven years and has been a member of PMPC for the same amount of time. 

Emerita has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents etc. In the future, she hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis 38 years old. He is married with three children aged 16, 14, and 12 years. He mends shoes and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This will be his second business loan. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to secure a permanent place to do his job. He hopes to start selling shoes in the near future.

loans.use: to secure a permanent place where he will do his business.

loans.name: Jamelin

texts.en:
Jamelin is married with three children. She is 35 years old and residing in Bagakay, Ozamis City. Jamelin owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living; she's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP through the business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2009, Jamelin joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Nonaliza

texts.en:
Nonaliza is from the village of Manante. She is a responsible mother who is willing to do everything that brings her income. She has been a hog-raiser for almost three years. She usually earns about 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month every time she disposes one. 

Nonaliza wants to have more pigs to raise. In this regard, Nonaliza is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise. With her determination and hard work, she will soon grow a better living through her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is 37 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Sumaya has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells beans, sugar and rice. 

To help expand her business, Sumaya has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, posho (maize flour), bread and other goods, and will help Sumaya to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Sumaya hopes that, in the future, she will be able to be a good entrepreneur. 

Sumaya is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Sumaya who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beans, posho (maize flour), bread and other goods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 57 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Grace has been working hard to generate income through her money transfer business and by selling chickens. 

To help expand her businesses, Grace has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hens, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve her way of living. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to have a large farm. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to support her mobile money transfer business and side business of selling hens

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo is 52 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Consejo has a business selling a variety of food including barbecue. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her barbecue business.

Consejo has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Consejo would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her barbecue business

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is 62 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is a widower and has four children. 

Julian is involved in the fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,900 each month doing this type of work. He is requesting a loan to purchase additional fish for resale.

Julian has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 56 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with eight children.
 
Leo has a store that sells consumable products. He has had this business since just this year. He requested a loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to be used in purchasing more stock for his general store, such as toothpaste, shampoo and beverages.

Leo has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Leo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for his general store, such as toothpaste, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 40 years old, married to Jackline and has been blessed with five children. He is an electrician, and he sells and repairs electrical appliances. He has been running the business for the last 16 years. His monthly income is 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is servicing his third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD., and this will assist him to purchase more electrical gadgets, spare parts and associated items. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in and increase his inventory. 

His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will make him improve the living standards of the family

loans.use: to purchase more electrical gadgets, spare parts and associated items for sale.

loans.name: Tehmina's Group

texts.en:
Tehmina is a 33-year-old, hardworking woman. She is living with her husband, two sons, and one daughter. Her two sons are studying in fourth and fifth class. She is working as a cook in a restaurant. Meanwhile, since 2000, her husband has been running his own tile and stone shop and is interested in continuing to grow his business. As both of them are working so hard to provide for the household expenses, they have not been able to give enough time to their children for the past few days. 

Tehmina is a member of a three-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva Field Partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's tile and stone shop. He will be using this amount to purchase more materials like tiles, stones, and a tile cutting machine from different cities like Peshawar and Lahore. As a result, her husband will be able to provide a greater variety of services to his clients and increase his net income and savings. Tehmina wants to live a good and simple life with her family. She wishes to renovate her house, to provide quality education to all of her children, and to fulfill all of the other basic needs of her family. She prays a lot for her children's better future and her husband's good health. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Tehmina is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband's tile and stone shop.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 56 years old and married, with four children. 

To make a living, Wilfreda has run a retail store for six years and earns PHP 2,841 a month for these activities. 

Wilfreda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 that she will use to buy additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

In 2011, Wilfreda joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Joel Juma

texts.en:
Joel is a 48-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has six children between the ages of 5 and 19. One of them goes to school.

Joel runs a general store, and has been in business for three years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase clothes and many other items. This business is his sole source of income.

In five years, Joel would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices. Joel says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Neelam's Group

texts.en:
Neelam is 46 years old. She is a hardworking and an independent woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Both of her sons are doing jobs, while her husband is a gardener by profession. But his income is not enough to fulfill his family's needs and to meet household expenses. Since 2004, Neelam herself has been running a livestock business; her younger daughter helps her as well. Now she wants to grow her business by purchasing two more buffaloes.

For that purpose, as a member of seven-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the profit amount, she is planning to purchase more animals like sheep, goats and cows, and she wishes to open a new dairy farm in the future. She says Salam and many thanks to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva both. 

Note: In the picture, Neelam holding a Brac Pakistan passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes for her livestock business.

loans.name: Ermilo

texts.en:
Ermilo is 38 years old and married, with three children. He is from Lapasan, Clarin. 

Ermilo has operated a transportation services business for five years, and he earns PHP 8,000 a month. In 2009, Ermilo joined GDMPC. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 that he will use to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 44 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married, with four children.

To earn a living, Elisa has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Elisa has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.  Elisa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elisa would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has run a sari-sari or convenience store for more than 20 years now. She sells various products in her store to the people in the community.

Carmelita is asking for a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more items to sell, such as bread, biscuits, candies, personal care products such as shampoo and bathing soap, cooking ingredients and others. 

Carmelita dreams of expanding her business so that it will augment her income for the sustenance of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as bread, biscuits, candies, personal care products such as shampoo and bathing soap, cooking ingredients and others.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is taking out a loan to expand her existing business. She has been a faithful, hardworking woman who has been able to repay previous loans. 

She says that thanks to the previous loan, she was helped to improve her services. Her goal is to open a new beauty salon in the future. The current loan will be used to purchase beauty chemicals like shampoo as well as a dryer, which will allow her to continue to improve her services.

loans.use: to purchase beauty chemicals like shampoo as well as a dryer

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 47 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married with three children.

Roselyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Roselyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Roselyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old and married to Ann.  They are blessed with five children that he supports. 

He operates a small food cafeteria in Narok.  He has been in the business for the past six years, earning an income of KES 20,000 monthly.

He is servicing his second loan of KES 10,000 from KADET that will facilitate in the renovation of his business premises.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business and provide for basic family needs. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Recy

texts.en:
Recy is 46 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children.

Recy is engaged in a snack vending business and earns approximately 3000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 11000 PHP to be used in purchasing more stock for her snack vending business.

Recy has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Recy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her snack vending business.

loans.name: 09.01.08 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Trọng is 64 years old and married, with three children  who are all grown up.  Trong lives in Thanh Hoa City. 

Trọng operates a food stall restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to buy materials to make processed food to sell. Trọng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Trọng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is the leader of a six-member group, the 09.01.08 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group. This is Trọng's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Trọng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 47-year-old married woman with five children, living in Bañadero, Ozamis City. 

To add income in the family, she entered into a business buying and selling plastic ware, which started five years ago. She usually gets PHP 4,000 per month. 

With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Angelita was able to buy more plastic ware to sell because of the PHP 5,500 rendered to her. She joined GDMPC in 2009. 

Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more plastic ware to sell.

loans.name: Arike Andria

texts.en:
Arike is a 35yrs old  businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10.  All of them go to school.
Arike runs a general store, and has been in business for 3 years. He has no employees.  He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4000sdg to purchase clothes, a sewing machine and other things,  This business is his only source of income. In 5 years Arike would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenge is high market prices. Arike says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items like clothes.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard and her family run a food and household goods trading business. Thanks to Silvard’s business her family is able to take care of themselves. 
Recently Silvard has bought a car, which her family uses for their business needs. Now they are buying merchandise for their business from suppliers. They are also able to bring merchandise from wholesale markets without assistance now. This fact allows Silvard to cut down on her business expenses. 
Sivrad used her previous Kiva loan to increase her shop inventory ahead of the New Year’s holidays. 

This is Silvard’s third loan from Kiva. Now she is seeking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a lot of canned products and household goods to resell before the winter comes.

loans.use: to buy canned products and household goods to resell ahead of the coming winter

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is from Gango, Ozamis City. She is 40 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Rosevilla plants, harvests and sells bananas. Rosevilla has been engaged in her business for four years and earns 6000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Rosevilla joined GDMPC. Rosevilla is requesting a loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the labor costs of farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is a 39-year-old married woman who has six family members from Al Naseer, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and do maintenance on her home. In the future, she wants to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 59 years old and lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 5 children.

To earn a living, Eufemia has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 1000 each month doing this type of work. Eufemia has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Eufemia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: 09.01.06 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyên works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Nguyên is 49 years old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 09.01.06 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of six members. Nguyên lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.

This is Nguyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nguyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nguyên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is a widow with 3 kids. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. Maria Fe is a farmer and she operates a vegetable garden business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Maria Fe been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Maria Fe hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: 09.01.07 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase general household commodities to resell.

Hoa is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 09.01.07 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group.  Hoa lives in Thanh Hoa City and supports her 2 children with her business.

This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hoa has operated her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase general household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is 25 years old and lives in Carangan,Ozamiz City. She is married with 1 school-age child. Niña has a business where she buys and sells farm supplies and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this. She has requested a loan of 3000 to purchase farm requirements such as fertilizer. Niña has been a member of PMPC for 7 months. 

In the future, Niña hopes that our cooperative can help to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm requirements such as fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing barrels of flour and oil.

loans.name: 09.01.05 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Liên is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell. She has a manufacturing business making rice vermicelli noodles.

Liên is 58 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 09.01.05 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa Province. She has no dependents; her children are grown up.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell

loans.name: Yeka Gabriel

texts.en:
Yeka is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba.  He is married and has two children, aged 3 and 6.  Both go to school.

Yeka runs a general store, and he has been in business for three years.  He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. 

He is taking a loan of SDG 3,500 to purchase clothes and other items.  In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years Yeka would like to expand his business and open other branches.  His major challenges include high market prices.

Yeka says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy clothes and other items.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and lives in Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with six children.

To earn a living, Delia has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month. Delia has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Delia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is 22 years old and is from Tulkrem. He has owned a farm since 2006. On the farm, he plants cucumbers, tomatoes, and eggplant.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy goods and seeds for cucumbers, tomatoes and eggplant. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and develop his farm.

loans.use: to buy goods and seeds for cucumbers, tomatoes, and eggplant

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 47 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.

Editha works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Editha has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Fenehas

texts.en:
Fenehas is a 52-year-old man who is married with five children. His eldest daughter is in a vocational school and the rest are in secondary school. His wife always tends the garden from which they earn some money.

Fenehas's source of income is from his cattle sales. He buys young bulls, fattens them, and then sells them when they are mature enough to be consumed. He has borrowed a loan of 500,000 UGX in order to buy two bulls that he will fatten within a period of three months and then sell at a profit. He currently has a stock of three bulls and the demand has increased, and that's why he opted to borrow money and restock his bulls. 

Fenehas says that he still faces a major challenge of insufficient land to graze his animals and at times he is forced to rent land from neighbours. He plans to buy more land once his savings increase and also improve on his homestead. Fenehas says that he has set his goals straight and won't be deterred from achieving them.

loans.use: To buy more bulls for fattening

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been a farmer in Olkalao for the last 12 years. She practices dairy farming and also plants cash crops like maize, beans, and cabbages. Her farm has been very profitable. She is 44 years old and married to James, who is also a farmer. The couple has four children.

This will be her second loan in KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and prepare the land for the planting season.

She wants to purchase plots and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and prepare the land.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 51 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with six children.

Tessie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Tessie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Tessie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Kahati

texts.en:
Kahati is well known in her community for her supplies. She expresses her thanks for the loans she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva, which have enabled her to move forward. 

Kahati is taking out another loan in the amount of 50000 KES to expand her existing business. Kahati will use this loan to buy more palm leaves to sell. She is sure that it will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves to sell for roofing houses.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a 55-year-old, married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from Getafe, Bohol, in the Philippines. She works in a fishing business since her husband is a fisherman. Fishing is the source of their income.

Gaudencia joined CEVI because she likes the services they offer. As of this time, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat. She also plans to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari or convenience store. 

Through this loan, her husband will be able to increase his daily catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market. Gaudencia dreams of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 62 years old, married, and lives in Malaubang, Ozamis City. She has two children. 

She earns a living through a food vending business. She has been doing this business for 11 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. Dionesia has applied for a loan of 6,500 PHP from GDMPC to buy more snack foods to sell. She been a member of GDMPC since 2008. Dionesia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell

loans.name: Alu Buga

texts.en:
Alu is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 1; all of them go to school.

Alu runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 2,500 Sudan pounds (sdg) to purchase clothes and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Alu would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Alu says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Bachiller

texts.en:
Bachiller is 31 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, in the Philippines. He is married with five children.

Bachiller works in the fishing industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for fifteen years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Bachiller has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita is 47 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
Rosita has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business. Rosita is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Zubeda Kadara

texts.en:
Zubeda is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of six and eleven. All of them go to school.

Zubeda runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2500sdg to purchase clothes and many other products to sell. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Zubeda would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Zubeda says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva .

loans.use: to buy more items like clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy candies, chips, biscuits, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 years old and lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lydia works in the fish industry and sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase dried fish to sell.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lydia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: John Eric

texts.en: John Eric is 27 years old and still single. Due to financial problems, he did not pursue his studies in college. Despite this, he helps his parents in managing their rice farming business to satisfy their needs and finance the education of his younger brothers and sister. At this time, he aims to increase his yields and income to save for his future. He plans to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming. He believes that this loan will be a great help for him to improve the business and hopes that he will have a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for rice farming

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 52 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Judith has been working hard to manage her cosmetics shop, which sells hair braids, weaves, and relaxers. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair products and a wide range of cosmetics.  It will help Judith to generate greater profits and pay for school fees. 

Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to live a good life and be self reliant. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Judith who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans

loans.use: to buy more hair products and a wide range of cosmetics.

loans.name: Genarda

texts.en: Genarda is from Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is 60 years old. Genarda is a widow and has 4 children. To earn a living she has managed a shoe shop for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from this work. In 2009, Genarda joined GDMPC. Genarda is requesting a loan of 8,500 PHP which will be used to buy more shoes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shoe to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 32 years old.  He is married, with three children.

He operates a motorcycle business, and he has been in the business for the past eight years. He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He will use the loan amount to purchase a tire for his motorcycle.  This is his first business loan from KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. 

Ronald hopes to have a stable income in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new tire for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chuff cuttter and materials to build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 42 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamis City. She is married and a mother of 5 children. Alma plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. She has been in business for 2 years. She earns 6,000 PHP for this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPCto purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alma been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Alma hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has a grocery business in Ndunyu Njeru town and has been in the business for five years.He is 44 years old,married to Virginia and they have four children.

This is his fifth loan. He plans to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in his business. These include mangoes and oranges, vegetables as well as potatoes. He plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Charles hopes to grow his grocery business and make more income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is happy now that she has a new young child. She is a dedicated woman who wants to get ahead. 

Alice is taking out this loan to invest it in her new food stall business. With this loan, she will buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, and flavors.

This is her fourth loan from Yehu. She is grateful for the previous loans she has received.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, and flavors.

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Lino is 54 years old and now a widow. He lives with his three children in a rural community. He cultivates their farmland by planting corn and vegetables to sell. He wants to improve his farming business to earn sufficient income for his family. 

Lino wants to educate all his children so that they will earn a degree and find a good job some day. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he needs to earn a higher income to satisfy his family's needs and finance his children's education. He planned to plant more corn and vegetables to sell, but doesn't have enough capital. 

Therefore, he is asking for an additional capital of 20000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for corn farming. He hopes that this loan will enable him to carry out his plan and hopes he will have a high production.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for corn farming.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul used his previous loan to buy a dairy cow. His dairy business improved and he was able to pay back the loan well and in good time.

This is his third loan and he plans to buy farm inputs. These include fertilizer, seedlings, and livestock feed.

In the future, Paul hopes to buy another piece of land and expand his farming business. This will allow him to make more income and provide good living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 42-year-old father of five children, has a beauty salon business in Naivasha town. He is married to Roselyne, who works in the salon.

This being his second loan, he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of salon materials such as weaves, braids, wigs, and beauty chemicals.

He hopes to grow his business, make more income, and open other beauty salons in the area.

loans.use: To buy beauty materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy candies, biscuits, and chips to sell.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat is married and has two children. She always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Sayohat decided to start a new business sewing national women's dresses in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

If you will help her with money, Sayohat would buy a sewing machine. She studied in a course called "To Get Ahead" in a women's organization and got enough skills about business. She will be a very successful businesswoman, as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 700 USD to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will come to be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business

loans.name: Drary Ashirafu

texts.en:
Drary  is a 45 year old  businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 6 and 15.  All of them go to school.
Drary  runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. She has no  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through  other clients. She is taking a loan of 2500sdg to purchase flour and many others.  In addition to this business, no other source of income.  In 5 years Drary would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.  Drary says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like flour to sell at his general store.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

Marie Grace has a store that sells spices and bananas. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more spices and bananas to resell.

Marie Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marie Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Yal Kawach

texts.en:
Yal is a 35-year-old  businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Yal runs a clinic, and she has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of SDG 2,500 to purchase drugs and other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Yal would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Yal says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy drugs and other items for her clinic.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Barbara is 39. She stopped her education in the 9th grade, lives at West Point with her husband and three children, that are between the ages of 5 and 18 and are in school.  Her husband is a contractor.  She has been selling coal for the past eight years.  She makes profit when she sells, since she is the only one selling coal in her community.  With the profit, she buys coals bags, and sells at retail. She learned to sell from her mother, and receives help from her husband to start in this business. She is requesting this loan to purchase bags of coal for the business. She plans to build house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her charcoal sales business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single lady who lives with in Kisauni, a suburban in the municipality of Mombasa.

Three years ago, Joyce decided to set up her own businesses, in order to obtain household income. Here she sells basic household products such as flour, rice, beans, sugar, salt, soft drinks, etc. In addition to this, she operates a tailoring and also sells charcoal.

She has applied to Yehu for this loan of 100,000 KES, to further stock her businesses with basic products, and earn the necessary income to support herself.

With this loan she intends to buy sacks of charcoal and add stock of household items in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and add stock of household items in her grocery store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old single mother of two children aged 14 and eight years respectively. She sells second hand clothes, a business she ventured into a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES.15, 000. 

She has requested for a second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bales of clothes for sale. She hopes to use the profit from this business to start a cosmetic shop. Her dream is to be a millionaire one day.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells skirts, blouses and dresses. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a wide variety of clothes to sell, and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and help run the family's affairs more smoothly. Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jestoni

texts.en: Jestoni is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has a week-old baby. He has been in the fishing business for some time now. This is his income. Jestoni is in need of additional capital for the construction and renovation of his house. He is requesting for a loan worth 5000PHP to buy materials such as cement, wood, nails; and to buy fishing nets for his fishing business. Jestoni believes that this loan could be a great help in improving their lives.

loans.use: to buy materials for the renovation of his house for his family including a new baby, such as cement, wood, nails; and to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Merlita has a store that sells used clothes. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy more used clothes to resell like blouses,pants and skirts. Merlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, William has been working hard to manage his food stall, where he sells tomatoes, passion fruits, vegetables and onions. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables like onions and tomatoes to sell in his business, and will help William to generate greater profits and help him grow the business with increased sales. William hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger grocery. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like onions and tomatoes to sell in his business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 54 years old and married to John.  They are blessed with six children, aged 2 to 18 years.  

She sells clothes, a business she has been in for the past 12 years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

She has requested a seventh loan worth KES 100,000 to purchase bales of clothes for sale. The profit she earns would be plowed back into her business. 

Her dream for the future is to start farming, educate her children, and also sell livestock.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 49 years old and is married with four children between the age of 18 and 25 years old. She owns a business selling various foods like: bananas, potatoes, beans etc. She has been in this business for six years and she currently employs two people to help her. 

Venantie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various food like: bananas, potatoes, beans etc for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save in her future, to build her own house and she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various food like: bananas, potatoes, beans etc for resale.

loans.name: Yayeri

texts.en:
Yayeri is 53 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Yayeri has been working hard to manage her catering business, where she prepares matooke, irish potatoes and cabbage. 

To help expand her business, Yayeri has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more local foods to cook like cassava, posho, and will help Yayeri to generate greater profits and help the borrower manage household expenses better. Yayeri hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Yayeri is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yayeri who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more local foods to cook like cassava and posho for her catering business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Ann is 51 years old, married to Samwel and blessed with four children aged 27, 23, 18 and 16. She sells clothes, a business she ventured into six years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 35,000. 

She has requested for a second loan of KES. 100,000 that she will use to purchase new clothes for sale. The profit she earns from this business will help her educate her children. 

Her dream is to be successful and open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Juliet  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Juliet  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Nemia has a store that sells viand. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy raw ingredients in making viand like vegetables, meat and spices. Nemia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nemia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viand

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen, 34, is a very cheerful, hardworking and enterprising woman living with her husband and two children; she lives in the town of Kisauni.

Doreen is a merchant selling clothes in a store. The business generates good income since she needs to cover her children’s needs. This is her second Yehu loan and she will use it to buy bales of clothes for sell so as to increase sales and income thereby improving the quality of life for her and her family. Her dream is to expand her business and open a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. Elma has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Elma  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bazirio

texts.en:
Bazirio is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Bazirio has been working hard to manage his general shop, which sells posho, rice, bread, juice and other general food staples. 

To help expand his business, Bazirio has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking oil, sugar, beans and other inventory, and will help Bazirio to generate greater profits and help his ability to pay for family needs. Bazirio hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Bazirio is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bazirio who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar, beans and other inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas, bales of flour, and a sack each of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Eliezel

texts.en:
Eliezel is 37 years old and is married with six children aged between 1 and 12 years old. His business is well organized and he sells various goods such as: lotions, biscuits, cooking oil, soap etc. He has ten years of experience and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Eliezel has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: lotions, biscuits, cooking oil, soap etc for resale. With the profit from this loan, Eliezel will be able to build his own house and reinvest in his business

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: lotions, biscuits, cooking oil, soap etc for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Mary Jane buys and sells products from Avon. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more products from Avon to resell, like lotions, perfumes and underwear.

Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jose Alfie

texts.en: Jose Alfie is a 33 year old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has an eleven year old son. He is engaged in fishing for more than ten years now. Jose Alfie has been a member of CEVI for some time now. As of this time, he is asking to take another loan for the expansion of his business. He is requesting for a loan worth 6000PHP to buy a new fishing net and fuel for the boat. Jose Alfie hopes of making his business a successful one. Moreover, he wants to continually send his son to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Atack Akot

texts.en:
Atack is a 35 yrs old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 11.  All of them go to school.
Atack runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3000sdg to purchase clothes and many others, In addition to this business, no other source of income. In 5 years Atack  would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Atack says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of kiva.

loans.use: for buying more clothes to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 35-year-old married man from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan, who has one family member. He is requesting a loan of 800 Jordan dinar (JD) to pay for his home improvements; he would like to do maintenance of the home and buy new furniture. In the future, he wants to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid, from Tulkarem, is 25 years old. The owner of a small company that cleans houses and offices, he has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy cleaning materials and a new cleaning machine.

Walid hopes that this loan will help him increase the scope of his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy cleaning materials and a new cleaning machine.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married with four children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Conchita is a farmer and she manages a gardening production to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and she earns 3,000 PHP each month from this work. She is requesting a loan of 3,800 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. 

Conchita has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she hopes that her children will complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 33-year-old  businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Betty runs a general store.  She has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of SDG 3,000 to purchase clothes and many other items.  In addition to her business, she has no other source of income. In five years Betty would like to expand her business.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Betty says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy clothes and other items.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal, a 29-year-old married father of a two-year-old, operates a well-organized business selling cows. He has two years of experience and currently employs two people to help him.

Pascal has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to buy more cows for resale. With the profit from this loan, Pascal will be able to build his own house and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more African clothes for resale.

loans.name: Scopas Batal

texts.en:
Scopas is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Juba.  He is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 12.  One of them goes to school.

Scopas runs a general store, and he has been in business for three years.  He has no employees.  He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. 

He is taking a loan of SDG 3,000 to buy clothes, a sewing machine, and  other items.  In addition to this business, he has no other sources of income.

In five years Scopas would like to expand his business and open other branches.  His major challenges include high market prices.

Scopas says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy clothes, a sewing machine, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men was born in 1944. She is a widow with three children who are adult and are married. 

Men grows vegetables and sells eggs for a living. Her total earnings are about VND 3,000,000 per month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. 

In the last cycle she borrowed VND 6,322,000 and repaid the loan on time.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 7,630,000 to buy vegetable seeds for growing and chicken eggs for selling. 

She hopes she could use her benefit to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for growing and chicken eggs for selling.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1984. She has two children who are learning at primary school. Her husband and she sell café and beverages for a living. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 6,000,000 per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed VND 8,502,000 and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 8,938,000 to buy ice cream, fruit juice, and fast food for upgrading her café store. 

She always wants to let her children keep going to school till higher education.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, fruit juice, and fast food for upgrading her café store.

loans.name: Joice Juru

texts.en:
Joice is a 43 -year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 13.  All of them go to school.

Joice runs a food store, and she has been in business for five years. She has no employees . She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of SDG 1,500 to purchase fish and other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Joice would like to expand her business.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Joice says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fish and other items.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a forty-two-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  

He has been a health information assistant for ten years, and with his meager salary, he has been able to buy land and educate his children.

Elisha also farms on a small scale. His major hardships are seasonal weather and a low salary.  His personal goals are educating his children, and upgrading his own studies. He also has a business goal of buying land to grow crops on a larger scale.

Elisha intends to use the loan to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Amenah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Amenah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her son. 

Amenah is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Koorah, Irbid, Jordan, who has five family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 Jordan dinar (JD) to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy new electronics and, in the future, she wants to repaint her home.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah 39 is a mother of three children,married and live in Congo town.  Her children are between the ages of 16 and 22. Her husband is a taylor.

She started by selling  palm oil.  Hannah now has a table in the market where she sells imported men shirt and jeans, ladies jeans and blouses.  She has been in business for eight years.  Because of the quality materials she sells and the way she interact with her customers, she makes a profit.

With the profit Hannah buys more goods for the business.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Liberia, to purchase more ladies blouses, men jeans and shirt to increase her sales.  Her plan for the future is to buy land and build house.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies blouses, men jeans, and shirt to increase her sales.

loans.name: Everketh

texts.en:
Everketh is a 42-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She also has three dependents who are grandchildren. She has been selling fish for 10 years, and with the profits earned, she has been able to buy land where she grows crops and also to pay school fees for her children.

She operates from the Uganda-Congo border, and fish has a ready market there since her major customers are travelers. Her personal goal is to educate her children and expand her business to neighboring towns despite challenges in high taxes and inadequate capital to meet the high demand.

Everketh is requesting a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a dedicated woman who considers herself to be God-fearing. She acknowledges all her success has come with God's power.

Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to incorporate juice-selling in her food stall. She sells a variety of fruit juices, which her customers enjoy while taking their meals. 

Rose is asking for this new loan to purchase fruit, water, sugar, and flavors for making juice to meet her customer's demands. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, water, sugar, and flavors for making juice for her food stall.

loans.name: Vivian Amane

texts.en:
Vivian is a 26 year old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two school age children, ages of 4 and 7.

Vivian runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years.  She has no employee.  Her major challenge is the high prices in the market.

She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.  Vivian is taking a loan of 1000sdg to purchase clothes.  In five years Vivian would like to expand her business.

Vivian says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan, through the help of Kiva .

loans.use: for buying more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some embroidery material.
